reviews.text: I mean... can you really go wrong with Cheesecake Factory?  I feel like it&#39;s just one of those staple restaurants that never fails.  Not fancy but not low quality either.  <br><br>After a long day of shopping, we needed to eat and ended up at this location.  We were seated fairly quickly for a packed early Sunday evening.  <br><br>I always get the same thing. The Jamaican black pepper shrimp. It never disappoints. We also had the pork belly sliders (delish).  The service was great and the drinks (mojitos) were awesome.

I am a cheesecake factory fan.. love the decor and ambiance..if you can&#39;t go to Italy let it come to you!<br><br>Service was good,asses of food choices. This time I had the beetroot avocado and orange mini salad... very nice especially with the crispy nut shavings  on top. My main was the skinnyliciois chicken pot pie, which was ok, although I would not have this again. My three stars is a reflective of my main dish which disappointed me somewhat.  However I would come back.

I love this place. Even though it is a &#34;chain restaurant &#34; the food and service never disappoint. Everything I&#39;ve ever had from here has been top notch - including my favorite pineapple mojito!

I recently came here for dinner with a large party of  about 20. Food was good and the service was ok. But  BOTH of their restrooms were out of order. I think this should have been something mentioned to customers upon approaching the hostess. Additionally, they were out of several menu items and came back to the table a couple of times for some of us to change our order.

Would not let my family group sit together because we lived in different homes.... ridiculous because it does not affect the restaurant in any way if we sit in a group. They would still be serving the same people. So since the manager could care less, we left to another restaurant.

Absolutely awful service one of the worst dining experiences in a long time. Me and my party of 9 went to celebrate a friends birthday and our server Sinai was cold and ignored us all night waited 20 minutes on water refills  cocktails were melted by the time they were dropped at the table. <br>Food took an hour for some and 90 minutes for others and all of it was cold <br><br>I sent back my food and it was returned to me nuked in the microwave. At no point after sending my food back was a manager brought by to check on me <br><br>Afterwards the desserts and togo boxes took over 50 minutes to come. After being fed up with the way we were handled we decided to adjusted the auto added gratuity. She confronted us about it and demanded we leave more money which is a huge red flag.<br><br>I and everyone at my table was in the service industry none of us would dream treating a table like this and I&#39;m frankly disappointed in Cheesecake Factory tonight.

Love this location, great service, friendly staff, and fantastic food. Our waiter made our anniversary date super nice. The location was really busy, but we had reservations and did not wait long. We have been in locations in the Midwest and on both coasts, this is our favorite.

I have been coming to cheesecake factory since dating my husband and it never fails me. The food is always on point. I love going to a restaurant that is consistently good. I hate going somewhere and the food is good  1 time then the next time it sucks.  The restaurant is a chain but  always good. The staff is usually nice and friendly.  The restaurant is clean and the decor has a Tuscan look very inviting. There is always a wait to get in so be aware especially on holidays wait can be from 2 hours. Usual wait time is 15 to 30 minutes. Now portions of the food is very good. I never get a chance to get dessert because I&#39;m always full from my entree. I usually do an appitetizer then a cheesecake in order to taste the desserts. I love the cheesecake factory only 4 stars because waiter forgot somethings we asked for and the wait time but  it was new years day so he will get a pass.

Visited THe Cheesecake Factory in Pines today. It wasn&#39;t our first time to this location but wanted to comment on the service by Melissa C.   She was great and making sure we had a wonderful experience.

Visited on a weekend &amp; I haven&#39;t dined here since before covid. Some social distancing in the patio was nice. Alex b. was a kind server &amp; gave me a nice drink suggestion/pleasant experience. Interested in trying cheesecake&#39;s brunch soon

First of all, shoutout to Brandon our server whose literally a boss at his job. We&#39;ve never been disappointed at this location, but Today was such an awesome experience. We got there with little time before work and I honestly thought it was going to be a 2 hour and 30 minute ordeal. From the time we left the car, ate, and left it was 1 hour.<br><br>Our drinks &amp; appetizer came out in a timely manner, we destroyed the calamari. I kid you not, we left crumbs. I love that they have cocktail and a garlic sauce and not marinara like other places. <br><br>We then ordered chicken chipotle pasta and Chicken Parmesan with angel hair. The chicken in the pasta was a little overdone, but the sauce and ingredients... AMAZING. The chicken Parmesan was so out of this world, moist, cooked properly and seasoned to perfection. We then finished with an Oreo cheesecake. Delicious.<br><br>I have absolutely no complaints about this place. It makes sense why it gets so packed.!
Great food. Great service. The waiter was very considerate in explaining vegan, gluten or dairy free options.

Last time I come here.  Customer service is out the door.  We purchased a great deal during Covid, and their app is horrible.  The online didn&#39;t go thru and the girl at the restaurant didn&#39;t see it.  So my wife submitted again, and when my son went to pick it up, they had 2 duplicate orders for me.  They charged me twice, total of 4 sandwich purchases.  The order was for 2 sandwiches.   We spoke to the manager and she was.not helpful.  She only gave us a credit for 1 sandwich, not two.   Poor customer service !!!!  Never again !!!

Love going to this spot for dinner or lunch! The service is always amazing and the food is so fresh. The menu has something for everyone and the desert variety is out of this world! Two things that I could live off for the rest of my life are pasta and seafood, so needless to say I ordered something that involves both. The Bistro Shrimp Pasta  is to die for. It&#39;s so creamy and flavorful and perfect for those that are not a fan of &#34;red sauce&#34; pasta!
Good variety and always very consistent. Thai lettuce wraps are my favorite! Their Cheesecake Factory merlot was very good.

It really helped having a reservation for 6:00 dining on a Saturday. The restaurant was totally crowded when we arrived but we hardly waited at all. Our server Oscar was outstanding every thing came timely and was delish!

I love cheesecake and it&#39;s a nice place sometimes for a quick meal.  When the restrictions from Covid was lifted slightly I did notice there&#39;s procedures for social distance &amp; cleanliness was not being followed once I advised the Manager she immediately handled it so great job.  My waitress Diva is always pleasant and on point.

I&#39;ve always come for lunch and dinner, but not for brunch. Got here right at 10am and we were sat immediately. We were greeted by our server right away and got ready for my wife&#39;s birthday brunch. My wife ordered huevos rancheros, I ordered chicken and waffles Benedict (amazing), and the others had chicken and waffles, and someone had the monte cristo, another great dish. Definitely recommend this place, but like all Cheesecake Factory&#39;s, get there early!

My sister and I made a trip to the Sephora in Pembroke Gardens After our shopping spree we were famished from carrying around all of our make up lol...so we decided to get some lunch. We walked over to the CheeseCake  factory there was no wait for lunch and we were seated immediately in a comfortable booth. The restaurant was clean and orderly and wasn&#39;t too loud. My sister ordered the avocado toast that had a beautiful presentation and my sister said that it tasted wonderful. I had the chinese  chicken salad the lunch portion and the dressing was extremely flavorful! Our booth had half walls on three sides so it was very private which made it a nice visit with my sister. Our server was amazing we never had to wait for a single thing but he also didn&#39;t come over too much and be a bother. It was the perfect amount of service for all these reasons I would highly recommend the Cheesecake factory in Pembroke Gardens.

This was my first time visiting this location. I normally go to their locations in Sawgrass Mills or on Las Olas so much expectations were based on those past experiences. Since we are currently in the middle of a pandemic every restaurant that I&#39;ve visited has a pretty specific set of guidelines they&#39;ve enlisted. The usual things such as face masks and social distancing are &#34;required&#34; here as well. Based on what I saw I&#39;d have to say that they are very slight suggestions. <br><br>Based on signage there is supposed to be one way in and one way out. At the entrance there was a young woman wearing a mask taking reservations. I gave her my name and number and proceeded to wait for an outdoor table. While I&#39;m waiting I see plenty of people walk right by the young lady and go right inside. I&#39;m assuming they will be sent back outside to put their names on the list but no one is sent back out. Also, the door clearly labeled &#34;Exit Only&#34; was used as an entrance multiple times and there was no one stopping people and sending them to the young woman to make reservations. That was bothersome to watch.<br><br>Fast forward and we are escorted to an outside table. The table was kinda clean but it looked as though every single crumb and leftover piece of food that was on the table was just wiped onto the seat. They were pretty easy to see since my 7 year old was the one that pointed it out to me. We waited a bit for someone to come and wipe off the seats which got me thinking about dirty surfaces. I asked the buss boy that came how often they wiped down menus and stuff and he told me after every new guest. I also asked my waiter and he said the same thick, which was very encouraging until I put it to the test. When I received my menu it was pretty nasty to say the least. I&#39;ve gone to multiple restaurants and everyone uses paper menus. Now I know Cheesecake Factory has a pretty extensive menu so that might be a challenge but they aren&#39;t a mom and pop operation and this isn&#39;t some low budget fast food restaurant so whatever the case may be this needs to be addressed. If you can&#39;t have someone actually wiping down these surfaces then you should be offering paper menus or at the very least give people a link to view it on their phones. Yes, having someone dedicated to wiping down menus or investing in paper menus is an added cost but I believe it can be done efficiently and effectively if taken seriously. Paper menus and plastic utensils should be an option.<br><br>IMO, it felt as though management was just pulling a PR move with the exit/entrance only, we wipe down all surfaces after every customer, etc. because I heard it all but I didn&#39;t see anything in action... it was all a facade.<br><br>I didn&#39;t see much inside so I can&#39;t comment on that but they were following social distancing guidelines outside. Every other table had been closed off. My waiter was wearing a mask and gloves. He was very professional and made great efforts to help me and my family remain comfortable. The outdoor seating was comfortable. It was very humid which made me realize that they didn&#39;t have any fans or they didn&#39;t have any fans on. The location in sawgrass always has them on.<br><br>Their portions are always excellent. I always leave with a doggy bag. The food was good. My son had the kids grilled cheese which he said was very cheesy lol. Not sure which way to go with that but the fries tasted good to me. I got the orange chicken which was very orange-y. I can&#39;t blame the restaurant but I&#39;m used to eating orange chicken with a slight teriyaki mix. The brown rice was good. I wish I could remember my server because he did an excellent job and deserves a shoutout.<br><br>All in all, my server and the food were both good. I felt a bit uneasy with all the social distancing errors I watched. This isn&#39;t the first week things have been open so I&#39;d assume that management has had enough time to fix the things they actually intend to fix which leads me to believe that this issues I stated won&#39;t be addressed. I&#39;m not sure if the problem resonates from the location or the chain overall but if it&#39;s the latter then I&#39;m just going to have to bypass them until I&#39;m able to let my guards down. <br><br>Seeing as Florida set a single day national record for COVID cases (worse then NY) on the same day I visited this location and witnessed all of this I&#39;m not sure how long that will be.

This business is not doing their best during Covid.  Walked in took my number and was told we would text you. As 30 mins went and tables that showed up after me was promptly sat. I told the hostess look tables are clearly passing me up and she told me to wait the system was not broken. Ok waited another 15min I&#39;m enraged at this point and asked for a manager who then quickly sat me. Oh it gets better, as I sat I was given my food with no setups nor napkin. I asked for these things only to be handed my utensil and one paper napkin while everyone around me had setups and cloth napkins. This place goes out of their way to not make you feel welcome. I guess I was the lucky one today. No worries Sawgrass is far better even Aventura in Miami has them beat. Remember the Hostess can be responsible for ruining your whole meal. They can at least be more welcoming and accommodating.

I have a tendency to order 3-4 appetizers for my entree because I can&#39;t commit to eating 1 thing. The buffalo blast is something we order every time we got. It have buffalo chicken and cheese inside wonton skin and fried to perfect crisp. The Korean fried cauliflower is my other favorite. It doesn&#39;t event taste like cauliflower! It taste like boneless wings with sweet and a airy sauce. A must try. And the loaded tots is a perfect side of carbs. Itexplodes in your moth with all the flavors of mashed potatoes <br>FOOD: A+++<br>CUSTOMER SERVICE: always attentive and friendly <br>COST: $$ per person <br>SERVING TIME: food comes out in 15-25 mins. Waiting time during peak house (weekends) could be a a long as an hour <br>AMBIANCE: semi upscale - high end casual <br>OUTDOOR seating: yes- covered <br>PARKING: plaza parking or valet

So to start, our server Alex was a sweet heart and my friends fish and chips were good. My spaghetti and meatballs ball on the other hand were aweful. Firstly they came out cold and I sent them back, when they can back out they were just warm, but my friend was almost done eating and I was hungry so decided to eat.  The meatballs tasted funny so I had a little of the pasta which was also like warm so decided not to eat anymore. When Alex returned and asked if I wanted a box I said no, and that the food was not good.  At no time did the manager appear and apologize and I was billed for all the food.  On my way home I had to pull over and throw up and am now in bed. Have called and let them know they should maybe take the meatballs off the menu today and Mike the manager has given a refund, and was very polite and professional, maybe one day we will go back!

I have not been to this Cheesecake in over 6 years. In fact, I have not been to a Cheesecake Factory since 2015. It was a late Saturday night when we decided we wanted food. Unfortunately, at 10pm at night, your only options are fast food. I was shocked when I saw all the local locations are open until 12:30am! So we ventured.<br><br>As usual, we decided to sit at the bar. It was pretty crowded but most empty chairs were occupied of purses by inconsiderate people. Luckily we found 2 seats together at the end. There were 2 bartenders, who were both busy when we sat. One said he will be right with us but the other wound up assisting us. I ordered the cucumber martini and hubby ordered some tiki punch. Both drinks were really good. Unfortunately, we peeked at the receipt and my drink was $14 and his was $11! So I ordered a glass of Riesling and hubby ordered a beer for the next round.<br><br>I ordered the chipotle pasta. It was described on the menu with a spicy cream sauce but the sauce was more tomato based. I used to order a pasta dish that was like this but more creamy and with farfalle pasta instead of penne. The bartender said the Cajun pasta was like that. Whatever, it was still good. Hubby ordered chicken fajitas and he enjoyed it. I always order the vanilla bean cheesecake for dessert. For some reason, it did not taste the way I remember. <br><br>The service was mediocre. Our bartender asked us if we wanted bread and it took him like 3 times to remember. They were professional, unlike many places around and did not appear to be messing around a lot. I do still like their food and will be back.

Ordered summer burger deal for takeout, overall great value for quality and quantity of food. Double burger, fries and slice of Oreo cheesecake. They also threw in a half loaf of hot bread.  I ordered online, waited about 2 minutes and they brought out our order. Food hot and fresh, thx CKF.  Will go back again to this location. <br><br>A couple demerits, no plastic ware or napkins. One of fries not properly sealed, dumped out in bag.

I was not impress by the service at all.. it was my moms bday and the waiter told me I had to &#34;remind him&#34; which I found to be very rude. My friend did not like the chicken Alfredo at all. Over priced for no reason..

A classic place where you know you will find a very ample menu with options for every one.<br>We went for a business lunch and enjoyed every minute of it.<br>Their menu now has many Gluten Free options and that includes an indulgent Godiva Cheese Cake.<br>The Grilled Salmon I ordered,  was cooked to perfection. There was a confusion with the sides but, hey! we are humans and it was solved immediately.<br>The best of all was the outstanding service provided by Jessica our waitress. She really is excellent, and we mentioned to the manager before we left.<br>We will definitely come back here.

Is so shameful in what the service industry has turned into you guys have a terrible le hostess in the front I know that is hard to get people this days but at least trained her she is mistreating your costumers , this is my neighborhood cheesecake and of course I will be back but never ever order pick up again I felt like I committed a crime and the hostess was punishing me for that , one star to you pick up service because can&#39;t give you less change that girl or trained her she doesn&#39;t say hi or thank you basic stuff! <br>HORRIBLE

The cheesecake factory is the cheesecake factory. I think when people go here they know what they are getting. For a cheesecake factory it&#39;s average. The positive of this place is that there is something for everyone.  However I did have a problem when I was there where we had been waiting for a table for a long time and there was this one party sitting there who had been there for hours as the hostess told us. They did nothing to hurry them along. I understand that they can take as long as they need and don&#39;t have to leave but I feel like the restaurant could have said hey We have a group of people who have been waiting here for a long time and they are a big group so the only place they can sit is here. They could&#39;ve offered them a drink or some sort of a voucher to get them moving along but they did nothing.

The manager is an older lady with a military style disposition. If you want to get yelled at right before dinner then come to the Cheesecake Factory @Pembroke Gardens. Please do better Cheesecake Factory. During these difficult times we need to be more merciful with each other. This is why my review will be short tonight.

Cheesecake Factory restaurants are always packed, and this one is no different. In the outdoor shopping center of Pembroke Gardens, this has to be one of the more popular restaurants as you will always get a wait time, especially on the weekends. They do do their best at getting you seated as quick as possible.<br><br>The service is always great and this time it was no different. Our waitress was very friendly, always checking in on us and making sure our glasses were always filled. <br><br>We both decided on the Farfalle pasta with chicken and roasted garlic. Wow, I was so surprised at how tasty it came out. It&#39;s rich and creamy, with mushrooms and peas. I was happy with my order, only a little disappointed that they accidentally made mine with penne pasta instead of farfalle, but it wasn&#39;t a big deal. <br><br>Always a good idea to go to Cheesecake Factory!

Chessecake factory is one of those chains that has a menu 30 pages long so I&#39;ve never been a big fan. Food is always good, but nothing stands out. This time the one thing that really stood out was the service. <br><br>We walked in and there was only two of us, but anybody who has been to this location knows there is always 100 people outside waiting so we expected a 25-40 min wait, but to our surprise we sat right away. Lucky for us we sat in Bryant&#39;s section.<br><br>He came over within a couple mins and took our drink orders. He came back after a few mins with the drinks and some bread. We were pretty hungry so we scarfed down the bread which always leaves crumbs everywhere. Bryant came back a minute after we finished, took the plates and even took out a tool to make sure the table was crumb free, my wife was very appreciative.<br><br>He gave us a few moments to look over the menu (you typically need 30 mins to decide) and we put in our appetizer and entree order at the same time. We ordered the cheeseburger egg rolls which were fantastic. A little greasy, but the flavors and the dipping sauce were delicious. <br><br>I ordered the gumbo with white rice. Lots of flavors everything well cooked. Good solid meal. My wife got the chicken costoletta, she gets it every time. It&#39;s thing crispy chicken with mashed potatoes and she subs corn for asparagus. She loves the sauce that comes with it so when she asked for extra we expected a small side but out came a small boat, again she was very pleased. All during the meal Bryant consistently swapped out our beverages without even asking. He made it very easy and pleasurable to dine there.<br><br>As we were wrapping up (i was done and my wife was just pushing what was left around) Bryant showed up again and took my wife&#39;s food away to box as well as got her cheesecake order. He came back two minutes later with her food boxed and let us know the cheesecake was coming. It arrived within 2-3 mins.<br><br>The whole experience at the restaurant was great. Again, it&#39;s a chain restaurant where the food will be good, but nothing standout, but with service like Bryant provided i would go back again and again!

This Cheesecake Factory has the longest wait time. The last time we were here was when we had family visit from out of town  I know the drill. It takes forever to get a table. Food takes a long time to come out as well. Portions are huge so be prepared to share or take home leftovers. <br><br>I always get the Thai lettuce wraps. They are seasoned just right. It&#39;s a light entree in case you want to save your appetite for cheesecake.<br><br>My son likes the Oreo cheesecake so I always get him that. The pieces are huge. They are truly a meal on their own. I like plain cheesecake or with fresh strawberries the best. Their coffee is a good finish to the meal. <br><br>The staff do their best to care for guests. I&#39;ve always had good service here. The managers usually  come by to check on things.

It&#39;s rare... but I think I just found one of the best waitresses in the world... Sara was super friendly, funny and accommodating, I can&#39;t say enough great things about her.<br><br>We stopped by for a late lunch, I ordered an Old Fashioned, while we got the Avocado Egg rolls for an appetizer.  The avocado Egg Rolls are our go to appetizer here.  We always get it, it comes with a tamarind sauce.<br><br>The menu at Cheesecake Factory is huge as any past guest knows.  I took a chance and went with something new, the Louisiana Chicken Pasta, which was good.  One of my friends got the Chicken Alfredo Pasta, which was definitely better though, but both good choices.<br><br>My wife got the Chicken Littles which is another favorite of ours, it came with a mountain of chicken tenders, and will be used as tonight&#39;s dinner, LOL.<br><br>All in all, a good meal and experience.
Awesome staff and restaurant. Did their best to accomodate everything despite the pandemic. Great job!

My husband and I would always eat at the Cheesecake Factory in Pembroke Gardens, Pembroke Pines, Fla. before Covid19 , and would enjoy the foods. However, Sunday, April 12, 2020 we decided to do a take out order of Angel Hair Pasta with Shrimp. BIG MISTAKE!<br>The food was horrible....... the pasta was dry, no kind of sauce or flavor. Four shrimp and a can of  diced tomatoes smeared over the top. Have the quality of food from this restaurant diminished due to  the &#34;virus&#34;? <br>Please....... We will never eat from there again.......

We have a love-hate relationship with The Cheesecake Factory, but it wouldn&#39;t be fair to generalize this location. I recently visited the Pines restaurant with my daughter. The restaurant was not full, so there was no wait at all. The hostess, however, barely acknowledged us as we stood right in front of her. No greeting, no eye contact, no smile, no nothing. She pretty much seemed bothered that we were there. She basically glanced at us and waited for us to tell her what we wanted. Not a very good first impression. <br><br>Fortunately, our server turned that around. He was friendly, polite, and welcoming. He was also knowledgeable about the huge menu, which no matter how many times we go, we still find it a bit daunting. <br><br>The food was good and as expected. Nicely presented and served at the appropriate temperature. I always have the 30th Anniversary Cheesecake and was sad to learn that it will no longer be available. <br><br>All in all, it was a good visit that was definitely made better by our friendly server, that totally turned our initial first impression around.

I&#39;ve eaten at this Cheesecake Factory many times and this by far is my favorite dish from all the menus. I&#39;m a lover of mushrooms and the combination of sweet from the balsamic drizzle and savory from the cheese created bliss in my mouth. Loved every bite. It&#39;s cheesy but not overwhelming. The crust is soft yet crunchy, I must say I was pleasantly surprised but pleased.

I was so excited to come and grab dinner as I have not been here in a long time and left very disappointed. As like most nights on the weekend, there was a lot of people waiting to be seated. When I went to the counter to leave my name, for a party of 2, I was told the wait would be 30 minutes. We waited and were called after 30 minutes. We were seated and our waitress was very pleasant and attended to us right away. We placed our orders and waited, waited and waited some more. The waitress checked on us and said the food will be out soon. 30 minutes later, the manager checked on us and apologized for the wait and said our food will be out very shortly. After one hour, our food had not come out while food came out to the surrounding tables that were seated  after us. Another waiter saw us still sitting there and came over to ask if we were Ok, at that point my husband asked to speak with the manager. The manager came over to apologize but we never really got an explanation for the delay. The food came out and was Ok but by this time we were so annoyed with the wait that we couldn&#39;t really enjoy the food. Very disappointing.

Their was minimum wait to be seated but the only reason I do not give 5 stars is because it took the server about 15 minutes to great us while we just sat their. Not sure if he wasn&#39;t aware that we were their but after he treated us he was very attentive, our food was out quick and it was delicious. Mac &amp; cheese was a bit distasteful but excellent service overall, I wish I could remember the servers name.

I&#39;m a huge fan of this chain, primarily because they have an encyclopedia sized menu.  Of course you come here for the cheesecake as well.  Just about everything I&#39;ve ever had has been pretty much above average.  I love the avocado egg rolls (a meal in itself) and the Korean cauliflower.  Vegans, vegetarians and carnivores should leave happy...and the Marmaduke sized serving portions offer that bang for the buck as well as mighty good taste quality.  There is enough outside seating to make things interesting.  Parking at this location can get a bit tricky during high traffic days and times.  Love the passion fruit flavoured ice tea.  The staff is usually young and they seem to know what they are doing.

I have to say Cheesecake Factory isn&#39;t my first choice. My husband&#39;s cousin wanted to meet there for dinner and I had a gift card so there we were on a Saturday night. We met early (which was great...when we left it was CRAZY busy). <br><br>We were told 30 minutes but were seated in about 10 minutes. One of our party was both there, but they still seated us. We ordered some apps while waiting and our friend arrived just after we ordered the apps. So everything worked out well. <br><br>We started with the edamame. They were cooked perfect and had the right amount of salt. We also had the roasted artichoke. It comes in 2 sizes. We ordered the larger one. Perfectly cooked. Not overly oiled and was tasty. I do eat vegan(ish) so I did taste the garlic aioli that came with it. It was very tasty. <br><br>Food:  my daughter had the spaghetti and meatball.  I would have preferred 1 more meatball and less spaghetti but my daughter loved it. <br><br>My husband and cousin had the burrito. It is HUGE. They both loved it. It came with beans, guacamole and sour cream on the side. <br><br>My friend had breakfast all day. He had a build your own omelet made with egg whites. He asked for 3 special requests. He only wanted a sprinkle of cheese and wanted his bacon well done. Omelet came out PERFECT!  <br><br>I had the avocado toast.  I have to say my picture doesn&#39;t do it justice. It was super pretty. The avocado was tasty and the bread was edible.  Some times the bread used for avocado toast just isn&#39;t easy to eat. This was perfect. The flavor was perfect. It was pretty. <br><br>Dessert:  my friend and I shared the Hershey cheesecake, it was worth the calories. I will leave it at that. My daughter had a scoop of vanilla. My husband had the Oreo milk shake. He said it was a little thin but tasty.  <br><br>All in all our service is wonderful. Food was delicious. Parking at Pembroke Gardens is horrible, but we valeted for $6 which was worth it. They text you your number so you don&#39;t have to worry about losing your ticket. <br><br>I think Cheesecake Factory may be in my rotation of places. They have a few options for me as a vegan eater and the kids&#39; menu also had a nice selection of choices. Looking forward to my next visit.

Located in an outlet mall. The Cheesecake Factory has one of the best happy hours! So happy, no wonder why you cheesing :)<br><br>From 4-6pm sitting at the bar area, appetizers and specialty cocktails are 5.95. While beers are 4$. No matter what appetizer you order; the portions are a good amount and shareable. The cocktails like the mojito I got was placed in a bigger cup than most the places I&#39;ve been to! Seems like they do it bigger and better at the Cheesecake Factory. They even give you complimentary bread and butter before you start your meal<br><br>Also, upon request I got the happy hour burger. It was a double patty burger that was gluten free. I didnt think anything of it. I was much more happier getting the appetizers (probably better off getting the sliders). I was also charged 2$ more for fries without the server telling me.  Service was alright. We didn&#39;t get refills until the end of our meal. Everyone was done with our drinks for awhile anticipating a refill...but nonetheless she refilled our drinks without us asking for it

I had not been a very long time since I stepped in a Cheese Cake Factory.  Not smart, since they have an awesome menu.  I couldn&#39;t believe how many different were one it.  <br><br>We started with some edamame and the grilled artichokes,  both were delicious.<br><br>For dinner I had the grande burrito. It is served with sour cream,  guacamole and black beans on the side.  It&#39;s a wet burrito,  it&#39;s not overly drenched in sauces or cheese.  Although I prefer a dry burrito it was very tasty and not over stuffed with rice.  The guacamole was really good too, I with I would have got extra.<br><br>My wife had the avocado toast.  It was topped with tomatoes and water crest. She said it was&#34; out of this world good &#34;<br><br>For dessert we got cheese cake,  it looked so good,  since I don&#39;t like cheese cake, I got an oreo milkshake.  It could have been a bit thicker, but it was very good.

What with the ever growing list of great places to eat in SoFlo, chain restaurants have taken somewhat of a back seat for me lately. With that said it&#39;s very hard to go wrong at The Cheesecake Factory, if you look long enough in the encyclopedia sized menu, it&#39;s pretty much guaranteed you can find something you fancy. That would actually be my only complaint about The Cheesecake Factory, the never ending menu that leads to far too much reading, time that could be spent eating! I actually counted 21 chicken dishes alone, and that didn&#39;t include pizzas or salads with chicken in them! <br><br>Started with the firecracker salmon rolls which were delicious; 4 fried egg rolls stuffed with salmon and served with a Thai chili sauce and red cabbage coleslaw. <br>The Chicken Marsala was next and was large and tasty but rather routine; a large piece of chicken served on a bed of bow tie pasta with a marsala and mushroom sauce. <br>Drinks are also usually good here as is the bread you receive before your meal. <br><br>Expect long waits in the evenings, especially on the weekends, I usually head straight to the bar area and try to snag a high top on my own, avoiding the wait, probably a bit naughty but it worked like a charm on this night and the wait staff rarely have an issue.

Went here on a Sunday night and the place was packed. Only went in for a quick dessert. Line had 3 people in front of me and once I ordered it took over 10 minutes to package and give me one slice of salted caramel cheesecake...it was hard to tell who was in line because the register is literally next to the door. I like the fact that all calories are posted, but what you don&#39;t know won&#39;t hurt you! All of the selections are packed with high calories, but everything is super delicious! Can&#39;t go wrong with a slice of cheesecake after a delicious dinner!

Enjoyed a birthday celebration here, thank you to the host staff and our waitress Natalia for wonderful service. I will definitely be back to this location. The food was delicious and came out on time. Same wine selection but great for small groups.

Cheesecake Factory in general is a hit or miss depending where and when you go. I came to this location because it is easier to get a table here than the location at the Sawgrass Mills mall in Sunrise. Came for their happy hour during the weekdays at 4-6 p.m. and to use a free cheesecake card we had when you purchased a gift card (this promo normal available for purchase during holidays). JI was told to sit anywhere in the bar area to be able to get the happy hour menu. The menu had a lot to choose from, drinks, appetizers and small dishes. Price range drinks $3-$6 and food is $5-$8, that&#39;s a price that can&#39;t be beat especially at this restaurant! <br>Since we were told to sit in the bar area we ended up waiting for a server. Which was strange because 5 servers pass the table yet no one informed our server we were there. After 10minutes of waiting I went back to the hostess to asks how can we get a server, her response was rude telling me that the bar is a seat yourself, I questioned her saying what does that mean. And informed her that she should inform service to that area or I&#39;ll ask someone that could help me. Still she did not get a server. So I waited another 5 more minutes and then finally a server showed up. And they were not in the mood that day. <br>Luckily with the time that we waited to be served we already knew what we wanted, so we can enjoy this happy hour. We order pretzel with cheese dip, crab dip, fried spicy shrimp, potstickers, and Korean cauliflower. Just remember you&#39;ll be served bread while you wait for your food. We enjoyed the pretzels, cauliflower and shrimp. The potsticker were not what I expected it just seem like I had a sliced chicken breast that was wrapped in a wonton, there was no seasoning and just sitting in ponzu sauce. The crab dip also was plain lack flavor . <br>Overall we had to take our cheesecake home, hazelnut cheesecake and red velvet chessecake,  because we were full. and it was the bread we ate because we had to take some food home so be careful and remember that there is bread to eat. We probably come back to eat regular entrees.

The service was great but the food was bland!!<br>We were seated immediately. I didn&#39;t catch the waitresses name but she was wonderful!<br>Mai tai drink- Very good <br>Pineapple chicken &amp; shrimp/white rice- Bland <br>Honey chicken- Ok<br>Mac and cheese- Watery and Bland<br>Banana Cream cheesecake- Very good <br>Calamari- Good<br>Bread- Always good

I had such a great experience at this Cheesecake Factory.  This isn&#39;t my first time at cheesecake but this was first time at this location. Let me tell you it was very nice!   There was a wait, but that was expected on a Saturday night. Every so, the hostesses were very nice making sure we had been helped and kept us informed.  When we finally got seated our server was very prompt on greeting us and making sure we were tended too. We got our food very quickly for the volume of people being there. <br>I ordered the chicken and biscuits. I was nervous because I haven&#39;t been here in a while and did not know what to order. This was a great choice! The chicken when it first came out was mixed in with the veggies, and at first I thought it wasn&#39;t enough meat, but it was a perfect mix.  I really loved the flavors and how they incorporate the sweet and warm biscuits to top it off.  Definitely going back here when I come back to visit my family in Miami. <br>Great restaurant!

Visited this location with family for my birthday celebration. Waiter was very nice and accommodating however our food was horrible which was a first ever.<br>No flavor what so ever my family member was highly disappointed returned order of shrimp scampi with steak diane for fried shrimp platter for sure this would be better. Negative shrimp had no taste along with the lemon garlic shrimp with angel hair shrimp was undercooked. <br>The only items which were tolerable were kids mac n cheese, breads, oreo cheesecake.

I enjoyed coming to the cheesecake factory it is one of my favorite places I love the atmosphere I love the food , the menu is a great selection and variety, the cheesecake deserts are amazing everything is awesome, definitely coming back with my friends and family. Highly recommend this place!!

I ordered an Ahi Salad from the under 590 calories menu, not sure what happened but the manager came out to tell me they were unable to serve it. It wasn&#39;t okay for me to eat it. So I went ahead &amp; ordered a shrimp salad instead which was delicious. But it was an annoying situation to have to watch 4 tables who arrived at a similar time than us receive their food, eat it and pay all while we still hadn&#39;t received ours. At the end, I wasn&#39;t charged for my salad which I am thankful for BUT honestly for the wait... I&#39;m not quite sure it was worth it. I think as a manager he should have asked if we wanted a cocktail meanwhile we waited? Or if we wanted an appetizer meanwhile we waited? Just so it didn&#39;t make waiting feel so long! <br><br>I think they handled it well but it could have been handled much better. Thank you to our waiter, I know it&#39;s out of your control but indeed, management could have provided much better service. <br><br>In response to the comment from the Cheesecake Factory, I am not an employee there let alone a manager there so I will not tell someone how to do their job. This is something they should already know and take care of impulsively.

Tons of options. Great portions. Consistent service and food. Cheesecake factory has the best restaurant biscuits I have had in a while. I love their chicken and biscuits. Also their cucumber lemonade is so delicious. I took some to go. Will definitely be back.

You can never go wrong with Cheesecake Factory...so many options for all different likings. I love this location because of the mall itself.  I don&#39;t come here often due to the distance...it&#39;s far for me. I love the outside mall it&#39;s welcoming and there are benches in every corner.  The mall it&#39;s well maintained - clean, garbage cans everywhere, building&#39;s paint is fresh. <br>Back to Cheesecake...I love they have so many satisfying options, the cost is reasonable, plenty of seating area including outside and service is quick.<br>This last time I came for lunch with friends. I had the lunch special Santa Fe salad with chicken. My friend had the personal cheese pizza with Caesar salad and my other friend had the wellness salad. Everything was yummy! My friend&#39;s daughter had the kids chicken tenders and fries which btw it&#39;s a reasonable amount. I think two 3yrs old kids can share the plate.<br>Sometimes the hardest thing to do when eating at Cheesecake is picking an entree due to their vast diversity of food. One of my fave is their lettuce wrap under appetizer menu. You can have it as entree like I do at times.

Super packed for a Tuesday. Although our waiter was really nice, attentive and made great food and drink suggestions, I felt like we were being rushed. And what made it worse, our food and drinks took forever time. By the time my dinner arrived, I had forgotten what I ordered. My Whiskey Smash was definitely amazing. This restaurant is in a really nice plaza.

It&#39;s always a good experience when I come to the Cheesecake Factory. <br><br>For such a large chain and one that offers such a big menu with so many options, they always delivery great quality food. I don&#39;t recall a single time I haven&#39;t enjoyed a meal here. And it&#39;s without say, their cheesecake is absolutely divine.

I make the Cheese Cake Factory a mandatory stop when I&#39;m bar hopping during happy hour at Pembroke Gardens. The bar tenders are professional and make good quality drinks. I usually get the mojito, it&#39;s really good. The nachos are a real value, it is definitely sharable. Their Happy hour is from 4 to 6, I think it ends earliest out of Pembroke Gardens restaurants so hit it early.

Usually I love this place. I ordered the Parmesan chicken Romano with white sauce to go. The chicken was cooked to perfection but my noodles were not done at all. Also putting the chicken on the bottom made it soggy in some spots. The noodlwere super hard and it was very disappointing. The chicken was the only edible part. <br><br>I would have loved to taken it back or said something was wrong but my order was to go and it was 30 min round trip to get and I had to wait 40 min to get the order. I wasn&#39;t going to take it back on a Saturday at the mall and wait another 2 hours.

I had really high expectations of the place, but they were really not met. I ordered a fettuccini alfredo and what I got it was pasta with the saltiest sauce ever. The pasta was undercooked and there was abnormal quantity of salt. There was no overall flavor and was no different to making pasta in my house. Deeply dissatisfied.
You can never go wrong here. Absolutely my favorite spo and definitely my go-to whenever I&#39;m hungry! Cheesecake never lets me down!
Thursday night....not so crowded. Seated fast and our server was great. Tried their steak from the SkinnyLicious menu. Was a hit not only with me but with fam. Will go again.

The ol faithful.  The tried and true.  Cheesecake is a solid go to chain restaurant.  They have their recipe of ambiance, customer service, food and drinks down to a science.  <br><br>The pembrooke location is a guaranteed good experience.  I LOVE their tamale cakes appetizer.  I could eat it once a week amd never tire of it.  I also love their lettuce wraps.  Its a spread of carrots, cucumber, bean sprputs, noodles, peanut chicken and butter lettuce.  You customise your wrap and it is fresh and crunchy.  <br><br>I can count on this place for a good cocktail and meal .
i always have a good time at the cheesecake factory. i always order something different since the menu has a lot of options, and every time the food is on point
Great service, thanks to the General Manager Michael. Kudos to you and Alex. Everything came out hot and fresh, the food was delicious.

Not ideal for any group outings larger than 6ppl. If you have a party larger than 6  you have to show up  and hope they have space for you  to be seated. Words direct from tonight&#39;s manager when trying to book  ahead.

Today I left with a sour taste on my palette it was HORRIBLE!!!!!!! It left me running to the ladies room. I ordered the Shrimp pasta with angel hair and it arrived within Reasonable time very visually pleasing so I dove In eagerly to be disappointed once I bit into a Shrimp it tasted like sampling mop water with vinegar when I made the waitress aware of my distain she offered to get me a fresh batch of Shrimp to replace these awful ones but those were bad also. She brought out the check after finally bringing me some grilled chicken to top my lackluster Shrimp pasta but she was still trying to justify charging me for the inedible SHRIMP PASTA then she had to get her Manager to remove this charge and I was a tad relieved still  upset I couldn&#39;t enjoy my seafood dish i wanted. I LOVE SEAFOOD ESPECIALLY SHRIMP OR SALMON it&#39;s a go to dish whenever I visit this place you&#39;ve got to do better.

We ordered takeout &amp; while my ALMOND-CRUSTED SALMON SALAD (Pan Seared and Served Over Kale, Shaved Brussels Sprouts, Arugula, Avocado, Quinoa, Cranberries and Radishes. Tossed with Our Vinaigrette) was delicious, the appetizer, KOREAN FRIED CAULIFLOWER (Crispy Cauliflower Tossed with Sweet and Spicy Sauce, Toasted Sesame Seeds and Green Onion) was SO BAD! The texture, the flavour, just bad. My friend&#39;s HOT SPINACH AND CHEESE DIP (Spinach, Artichoke Hearts, Shallots, Garlic and a Mixture of Cheeses. Served Bubbly Hot with Tortilla Chips and Salsa) was ok but I&#39;ve had better. Her CHICKEN, MANGO AND AVOCADO SALAD (Mixed Greens, Fresh Pineapple, Tomato, Cucumber, Red Peppers, Onion, Crispy Wontons and Almonds. Tossed with Vinaigrette) was HUGE  &amp; looked really good but since I don&#39;t eat chicken I did not try it. She assured me it was great. For dessert, we split a slice of the CHOCOLATE HAZELNUT CRUNCH CHEESECAKE (Chocolate Hazelnut Cheesecake Topped with Hazelnut Crunch and Nutella®) &amp; it was just as delicious as it sounds. All in all, pretty decent

We decided to visit Cheesecake Factory in Pembroke Pines at the Pembroke Gardens Shops. It was a great lunch, like always food was delicious. They have a great kids meal, includes burgers, chicken, and pasta.  My wife and I had a salad very filling.  Typical plate at Cheesecake Factory is large so you can share if you feel you have the appetite for sharing. We had outside seating that was nice for the weather. However, if it is hot outside I would stay away from outside seating. <br><br>My only complaint is the service was very slow and at times forgetful.  My daughter had to ask for ketchup a few times and requesting additional napkins took some time also. <br><br>Parking: You have valet parking right at front for a fee and then throughout the exterior (free)
The crust salmon with mash potatoes and asparagus was great! Also I tried the white chocolate macadamia nut cheesecake for the first time and I would recommended
Not only was it a half portion of rubbish<br>Pasta was ROCK HARD<br>HEAVILY UNDERCOOKED<br><br>As always a huge disappointment.
Cheesecake Factory never lets me down. The food is amazing. I love going and getting a bunch of<br>- small plates and appetizers. They have such a large variety it is difficult to choose.

This restaurant is located in a cool shopping square, for good retail options during the day, and happening night life! I went here with a group of about 12 persons on a very busy night. Service was great and friendly. It was not very quick, but we were a large group and it was a full house so no complaints there... Our server was very timely and checked on the table often, refilling waters and meeting other needs. All the entrees that were ordered looked nice and were well prepared. I just wish the lighting was a little better in here than it was outside at night!  Otherwise a good experience, a good option for lunch/dinner, great decor and location. Food is good, stays true its the restaurant chain quality and options.

Came here on a Sunday night, thinking the wait would be long but for a party of 7, it was quite fast! Once we were seated, the waiter attended us pretty quickly and took all our appetizer orders with no problem. I ordered the avocado egg rolls and they were delicious! When ordering the entree, I was a little conflicted on what to order because I usually order the basic chicken Alfredo but I wanted to try something new. The waiter recommended me the chicken bellagio and I decided to go with it. Definitely no regrets! I devoured the entire thing! Every dish on the table looked amazing as well. My boyfriend ordered the chicken Alfredo, a friend of mine ordered a filet mignon, and another ordered orange chicken. The rest was variations of pasta which also looked amazing. I&#39;ve been to this cheesecake a couple times before and it never disappoints. My next goal is to try to brunch menu
Not keeping the people and staff safe. People in line not wearing masks and rude to workers.

I had such an amazing dinning experience tonight! (12/1/19) And it was all thanks to Bryant! From greeting us  so quickly, noticing we were short utensils, bussing our breaded plates to make room for our meals , bringing my red paper flakes/condiments prior to our dishes arriving to refilling our drinks without us even asking! Great great service! <br><br>Even though it started off a little rough when I stood in front of the hostess stand for a good 3 minutes, and was not greeted by the 3 hostess nor manager...but Bryant made it all better. Thank you Bryant!

I have to say cheesecake is one of my favorite restaurants due to the farfalle pasta. This visit I wanted to try something a new. The New York strip was at best average but everything else was phenomenal. Drinks were great. The Cheesecake Factory is a perfect ambience to celebrate a birthday.our server was amazing 0 complaints and was amazing at not feeling pressured or rushed when my family took a while lol.I highly recommend this place. You will enjoy it. Until next time cheesecake

I love The Cheesecake factory but this location has let me down today.  I usually come for dinner.  Today I came for lunch.  Spoon was dirty. The salad I ordered didn&#39;t taste fresh as the lettuce was wilted and the chicken I requested to be hot off the grill came cold. I understand that these experiences will happen but what added more to the unpleasant experience was a non- service dog that was in the restaurant.  It ran from it&#39;s owner.  It barked several times and I think it&#39;s very unhygienic to have a dog in a restaurant.  Honestly,  I was very disgusted from the dirty spoon to the dog running free. Fur can easily fly everywhere considering how fluffy this dog was and the cold chicken just didn&#39;t help. I believe this location needs better management.

Good things come to those who wait....and you can usually expect to wait for a table when you arrive here. That being said, the food is worth it and the cheesecake even more so. <br>My latest trip here was  to pick up a whole cheesecake I ordered for a family party. They were super nice on the phone and had it held for me. Easy pick up! I recommend it whenever you need a dessert to impress and you don&#39;t have the time (or perhaps talent) to bake it yourself.

Cheesecake Factory !! Love love love !!! Came here tonight with a few friends , 20 min wait time to be seated, ordered appetizers (Thai lettuce wraps , nachos) took 30 min to arrive waiter did apologize, <br>Dinner bang bang chicken delicious has a kick , curry , coconut, rice . We got salted caramel cheese cake for dessert, American coffee was cold <br>The weird part was we got plastic forks with our dessert . This restaurant is above average price range for dinning . $16-$30 per person why do I get plastic forks with my cheese cake ? ( I had a spoon for my coffee from dinner services )

We went out for a late lunch-- and chose stuff we don&#39;t usually... this was the best idea ever!! Well, Cheesecake Factory never fails, imho. They are a good food factory! I never even make it to the cheesecake cause the food is soooo good!! <br>So this time we went for appetizers: the 4 kind of eggrolls ... and we were pleasantly pleased!<br>Well-- to be honest, we loooove the bread too! So bread and appetizers and iced tea... then I had my &#34;low cal&#34; salad- hahaha.<br>Louisiana Chicken Pasta and I don&#39;t remember the salad name-- but it was GOOOD!

Usually no issues but our appetizers were delivered with our dinner. This made enjoying our leisurely meal a challenge as our table was covered with food all at once. <br><br>Our waiter was friendly and the food tasted great but the experience was lacking.

Always a pleasure coming to Cheesecake Factory. The staff are all super friendly and try to satisfy you as much as possible. Strawberry lemonade is one of my favorite drinks when I go there. Their salads are delicious and a good size. I also go for their pasta carbonara and it never disappoints. Going on a weekday night is so much better than the weekends whereas you are seated right away and don&#39;t need to wait for a table. A huge fan of their chocolate tower truffle cake, definitely something you would share with another person!

This location is very convenient! It is in the middle of Pembroke Gardens! However, the only downside is that the wait can take from 30 minutes to an hour. It is extremely busy during the weekend all day. But weekdays is very light traffic. There is an indoor and outdoor seating in this location. It can get pretty loud inside the restaurant. I only request to sit outside, if the weather is nice and not too hot or during sunset.<br><br>I have never had any problems while dining at Cheesecake. The service is always good. The menu has a whole variety of food. They also have a skinny menu. The portions are extremely big! So prepare to have left overs for the next day. Also, YOU CAN NOT MISS THE BROWN BREAD or the pumpernickel bread. It is must that you must taste this bread while waiting for your food. When we come here, we usually order the Thai Lettuce Wrap as an appetizer. This appetizer is fairly big to share around the table. You can create your own lettuce rolls by adding anything you want in it. We ordered different entrees. The Chicken Bellagio comes with chicken bread over basil pasta and Parmesan cream sauce and topped with arugula salad. Also, if you can&#39;t decide what you want to get, you can get the factory combinations! It comes with two items and mashed potatoes. We got the steak Diane and herd crusted salmon. All our meals were very good and came out by the time we finished our appetizer.
Butter was cold but made an appearance to be melted. Bread if not warm. Food took a while but it was good. Service was average as the waitress never came back to check on us. Overall average place.

This place is amazing! I&#39;ve been coming here for a while, and it never fails me. The spinach and artichoke dip is AMAZING. You should definitely try it. I&#39;ve had a couple iffy servers, but besides that the food is great and so are the food selection. Today is my first time trying the chicken Parmesan pizza and it&#39;s definitely one of my favorite things now. Cheers!!

I consider myself to be a woman who knows excellent service. If you ever have the opportunity to dine at The Cheesecake Factory in the Pembroke Gardens mall, servers Brian and Julio (Diva) will not disappoint.  I&#39;ve been lucky enough to be served by one or the other every time my family has dined at the restaurant and level of service has always exceeded my expectations.  I, truly, am impressed!<br><br>If I were the owner of a restaurant, I&#39;d definitely want employees like these. They truly set the bar.

I had a wonderful experience at the Cheesecake Factory. When I arrived around 1 pm it was packed but because we were only a party of two we were accommodated to a 2 seater booth. Our server names was Gibran who was absolutely wonderful. He had a great personality and excellent customer service skills. He was able to provide feedback on the menu. I ordered the classic Avocado Eye-rolls and the Soup of the Day. My friend ordered the Fish Tacos which she didn&#39;t like. The breading on the fish was too thick and inside was a bit wet. We did share our feedback with Gibran who graciously provided us with another recommendation. My friend ended getting the Jamaican Jerk Shrimp which she loved! We also was greeted by the general manger Mike- who asked us to provide feedback on the fish tacos to improve the dish. We really appreciated the gesture Mike! This is what customer service is all about :) Overall I had a great experience and I truly appreciate the A1 Customer Service.

In between Christmas shopping came for a bite. One thing I can say that this chain of restaurants offer consistency with the taste of their food . We had the beets with goat cheese and the Korean cauliflower. They seemed to have been a little skimpy with the goat cheese and we could barely make out the scant crumbles on our plate. I would suggest a tad bit more goat cheese to justify goat cheese being mentioned as part of the dish. Cauliflower was tasty but salty (but tasty). My rice was cold and my husband&#39;s dish was misleading. Honey chicken something aka fried chicken breast in batter. It was okay but he was cutting off the crusted batter to make it to the chicken (I ate his carbs for humanity though). Of course we will be back eventually cause they are just convenient restaurants nationwide. Live and love!

I have a love-hate relationship with the Cheesecake Factory. At this particular location, I had a lovely experience this weekend. We were out shopping on a Sunday and we wanted brunch food so we stopped by around 12pm. It was PACKED! But we decided to sit outside because there was no wait for a party of two and we were starving! I didn&#39;t get our servers name but she was very attentive! As soon as we sat down she brought out their delicious bread and took our orders. I ordered a peach Bellini and my BF had an old fashioned. The Bellini was delicious and refreshing but my BF did not like the old fashioned. We stuck with the brunch options from the menu. My BF had the chicken and waffles and I had the eggs and potatoes. I ordered my eggs scrambled and they were cooked perfectly. The potatoes were so delicious and I added a side of bacon. My plate also came with toast but I didn&#39;t like that they only toast one side. The chicken and waffles were amazing! The chicken was crunchy and delicious and the waffle was crispy on the outside and soft and fluffy on the inside. That waffle was one of the best Belgian waffles we&#39;ve had. I have been to this location numerous times and besides the wait times I&#39;ve always had good experiences.

Always a good place to grab a bite. Just be prepared the menu has a lot of options which can be overwhelming at time. But if you&#39;re not sure, here are a few options.<br>Feeling Spicy - try the Cajun Pasta<br>Feeling Seafood- try the miso salmon
Love it all the way. Customer service, food, all of it. I usually eat here weekly, it&#39;s that good.
Typical cheesecake factory - great food and desserts. Overwhelmingly large menu but I rather that then limited options. Food arrived timely and service was good.

Not the best Cheesecake Factory I&#39;ve been to...<br><br>My fiancé and I came here for brunch on a Saturday around noon. We were seated quickly but it took about 10-15 minutes for us to be acknowledged by our waitress. <br><br>We got our beverage orders in and gave her our entree orders shortly after. My fiancé got the brûlée&#39;d French toast with a side of bacon and eggs. I got the brunch combo which comes with eggs, bacon and pancakes. I asked for eggs over easy. She asked me if I wanted potatoes. I said I didn&#39;t think they came with potatoes and she said &#39;oh yeah you don&#39;t get those. Never mind.&#39;<br><br>Ok so we waited for our entrees and when they came, my eggs were scrambled. I ate pretty much everything else and waited until she came back, which was about 10-15 more minutes later. Then she said &#39;oh you wanted them over easy&#39; and then proceeded to take my clean fork off my table and scrape them off my plate in front of me onto another plate to take them away. Seriously??? Then she walked away and came back a minute later to say &#39;you wanted them scrambled right?&#39; I said &#39;what no I wanted them over easy&#39;. She gave me the most confused look and then said &#39;ok over easy then&#39;. <br><br>There was no apology no discount on the bill, nothing. I don&#39;t usually expect discounts or anything like that but an apology would have been nice. We didn&#39;t see her again until the bill was paid. I couldn&#39;t help but notice some other people sitting nearby were also upset with their food. <br><br>Save your money and go to a different location or restaurant.

I&#39;m writing this review primarily to request that Cheesecake Factory replace its plastic straws with paper straws.  American Airlines, Starbucks, Mc Donald&#39;s UK and Hyatt, Bon Apetit have already banned plastic straws. <br><br>If you agree please vote for this review.<br>See <a href="/redir?url=https%3A%2F%2Fwww.google.com%2Famp%2Famp.timeinc.net%2Ftime%2Fmoney%2F5333715%2Fstarbucks-hyatt-ban-plastic-straws&amp;s=d46e37c7e4fd63ed211e1f2661a67c4c89df45c64dc47f960c222b348fe5ceba" target="_blank" rel="nofollow">google.com/amp/amp.timei…</a><br><br>Many states, which likely have Cheesecake Factory locations, are in the process of banning straws. This includes: New York City, Hawaii, California, and Washington. Here in Florida, Miami Beach and Fort Myers are also tackling the issue. <br><br>Thus, certain Cheesecake Factories will<br>be required to either ban all straws or replace plastic straws with paper straws. I request that this ban or switch to paper straws also apply to all<br>Cheesecake Factories. <br><br><a href="/redir?url=https%3A%2F%2Fwww.fastcompany.com%2F40580132%2Fhere-are-the-u-s-cities-that-have-banned-plastic-straws-so-far&amp;s=7f99a645b71b7a124822f207295d9193e5e9070d2b2a0e2879f7bda898a290a7" target="_blank" rel="nofollow">fastcompany.com/40580132…</a><br><br>Cheesecake factories located in those states and cities will be effected and required to use plastic straws. <br><br>I appeal to Cheesecake Factory in Pembroke Pines to join the movement and the other Cheesecake Factories to replace plastic straws with paper straws. <br><br>Now to the review:<br><br>Summary is that I come back again and again because the variety of the food is great for groups and it&#39;s reliable. That being said, there is room<br>for improvement. <br><br>Cheesecake factories are a family restaurant so offering crayons and coloring to kids would be fantastic!<br><br>Ambiance outdoor seating 3 stars (as long as the weather is good): loses points for view of parking lot; sometimes gets too hot in the middle of the meal <br><br>Ambiance indoors 3.5 stars <br><br>Bread Starter 5 stars<br><br>Skinnylicous Chinese Chicken Salad - needed more dressing 3 stars <br><br>Spicy Chicken Chipotle Pasta 3.5 stars<br><br>Chicken Parmesan Sandwich 4.8<br><br>Skinnylicious Veggie Burger 3 stars: it&#39;s good enough and I appreciate the vegetarian option. I&#39;d be on the fence about ordering again depending on the other skinnylicious veggie options which I don&#39;t remember now. <br><br>Customer service: 3
It&#39;s Cheesecake Factory, I can never complain. This particular location is nice, not as busy as the ones I usually go to so that&#39;s a plus. Service is always good as well as the food.

This is what every girls lunch needs... an endless menu, window table, cute server and good food.<br><br>When you aren&#39;t sure what you want, this is the place.  The menu has everything. The appetizers are all enticing, salads, sandwiches, entrees and don&#39;t forget the dessert.  These are formulas driven and in my experience consistently serve good food in a fast pace environment.<br><br>I do consider Cheesecake Factory an everyday go to stop.

I really enjoy coming to this  particular Cheesecake Factory, today  we chose lunch instead of our usual Sunday Brunch and some very tasty and refreshing margaritas ( I ordered a Skinny Margarita at 100 calories tasted absolutely delicious!!) My husband ordered a passion fruit one instead but he agreed that mines tasted a lot better and wasn&#39;t as sweet as his . As an appetizer we ordered the Mac &amp; Cheese Balls- if you haven&#39;t tried these you really need should. It is served as 4 lightly fried balls stuffed with Mac &amp; cheese and placed on top of some marinara sauce  sooo good!!! (I know - nothing skinny about them but definitely worth indulging) For our main dishes the Skinny Factory Chopped Salad was my choice and my husband ordered the Mushroom Burger &amp; my daughter ordered the lunch portion Fettuccine Alfredo Pasta. Everyone enjoyed their food . My salad was full of flavor and the burger was cooked perfect, the sautéed mushrooms added a great flavor to the burger.

This is our go to place, me and my high school girlfriends.<br><br>One of the best things about Cheesecake Factory, is there is something for everyone. Pasta, salad, burgers, fish, and obviously CHEESECAKE!<br><br>Today I ordered the kale salad and opted for the fried calamari as my entree, not so healthy but calamari is my fave.  I always order the passion iced tea, passion is a good thing! The salad was nicely seasoned and had the right amount of dressing. The calamari could have been cooked just a tad bit longer, or possibly a bit less breading, but it was still yummy.  Nicely seasoned too.<br><br>And since it&#39;s November, PUMPKIN CHEESECAKE!! My girlies and I always meet up at this time of year to taste this baby. Geez, I thought I was going to explode. <br><br>J got the beet salad (yes!) and the lettuce wraps, I almost traded plates!<br>E started with the artichoke, great choice, and the greek salad, to save room for her pumpkin cheesecake.<br>K had a side salad and the chicken pasta from the skinnylicious menu, WOW! <br><br>Everything was fresh and tasty. <br><br>Only sorta kinda gripe was the time it took to get the check.

YUMMY! I went to The Cheesecake Factory for lunch and the food tasted so good! Parking was not hard to find. The hostess was very nice and we were seated quickly. The server was also very nice and friendly. Started out with a Caesar salad that tasted so fresh and good! My friend ordered Buffalo wings as an appetizer and it was delicious! I ordered a Ribeye Steak with Mash Potatoes and Asparagus. Just thinking about it is making me hungry all over again. I got it medium well and it tasted really good. The mash and asparagus was also tasty. The strawberry lemonade was also good! Finally we decided to try the Birthday Celebration Cheesecake. It was our first time trying it and it was AMAZING!!!! Overall, we had a really good experience and will be going back.

Considering it&#39;s a chain, service, food and drinks are always good<br> We&#39;ve been to several different locations and they are consistent in their brand. It&#39;s great place for large groups, and couples . Portions enough for 2!
The manger is kinda of a jerk but whatever lol. The food is great and so is the cheesecake.

Back here at cheesecake.   It&#39;s always a pleasure eating here<br><br>I&#39;m at Pembroke Gardens, which usually is packed today we were seated in 10mins. Pretty good<br><br>Service was excellent and timely

Great service today! I&#39;ve been to this location numerous times and I am never disappointed. Food and service is always pretty good. I had the meatloaf today it was ok but the corn succotash and macaroni and cheese were amazing! They are always busy, but I&#39;ve never waited more than 5 minutes for a table.

Pros:<br>Food is consistent  <br>Service was good<br>Atmosphere was nice<br>Place was busy as usual<br>Cons :<br>But the Cheesecakes are expensive as usual and now they have made the slices of cheesecakes much smaller.

Came here at 11:58 for brunch was crowded but not overwhelming as there were seats and the staff was on it.   Decided to sit at the bar.   Bartender was attentive and got our drink order quickly.   Well two orders of bread and over 25 minutes later we&#39;re still waiting for our order - two orders of eggs Benedict.    Manager just walked over as I&#39;m writing this so thanks.  Maybe they&#39;ll comp the meal or drink - <br><br>Update - the bartender got us an extra round - kudos to her!<br><br>Photo caption reads &#34;hungry&#34; thank goodness for bread

Food is good, kind of pricey. Had the steak tacos, girlfriend ordered a poke bowl and had a slice of cheesecake to go, 50$ not including tip. Come for the cheesecake not so much the food. Good and fast service though! The complimentary bread and butter is also very good.

Lunch hour special 4-6 mon-fri! I got the hot spinach and cheese dip, factory nachos, and roadside sliders. All of the appetizers and a couple of drinks are under $6 during lunch hour. The portions are great for the price! The nachos were a little burnt and they just pop it in the oven. The spinach dip tasted alright and it was hot. My favorite part of the meal was the sliders, the bread was toasted perfectly and the chicken was crispy and juicy. They also have FREE BREAD!!! 3 different types served with butter. The service was spectacular, our waitresses informed us about the prices and lunch hour. She checked up on us multiple times and kept a positive attitude.

Arrived around 6:30pm on a Thursday night and waited about 10 minutes for a table. They serve you their Famous Brown Bread and a french bread that are freshly baked and delicious. (Apparently you can buy these in some supermarkets now) The spread is real butter so it tastes better but is hard to spread. Honestly, the breads are so good they don&#39;t really need anything on it. The Cokes where really good. Not everyone serves them this good. I ordered the Louisiana Chicken Pasta and it was completely amazing. It is made out of Parmesan Crusted Chicken Served Over Pasta with Mushrooms, Peppers and Onions in a Spicy New Orleans Sauce. Its spicy but not overwhelmingly spicy. Just a little kick to it. It is a really big plate that can be easily shared or turned into two separate meals. Seriously, I have an appetite and I just ate half of it. Overall, I was really surprised at the quality and taste of the food. Service was great too and though the server was brief, we didn&#39;t have any needs that weren&#39;t met in a timely fashion. Great job!
Huge menu. Always a fun time with friends. Great spot for birthdays. You have to try the Oreo cheesecake!

The main reason for the 3-star rating is the slow service you get 50% of the time. I totally understand  if the kitchen is backed up during the busy hour, but when the restaurant is less than half full it shouldn&#39;t take half an hour to bring out two lunch entrees. The staff are relatively friendly for the most part, so thumbs up for that.<br><br>There happy hour specials are awesome! My recommendation is the happy hour burger because you will get the most bang for your buck. It&#39;s basically your standard double cheeseburger on a brioche bun. For $5.50<br><br>Avocado eggrolls have a nice tangy taste to them and comes with a sweet Asian-pesto like sauce. Definitely worth trying.<br><br>Cheesecakes are a little overpriced in my opinion. One slice goes about $7. That&#39;s more expensive than getting a meal off the happy hour menu. In my opinion, desserts should definitely be cheaper than the actual entree itself for a even sweeter ending to your meal. My favorite is the tiramisu and white chocolate macadamia cheesecake.<br><br>Mojito and Long Island iced tea are on par. Get those during happy hour.

Service is always bad at this location. Servers barely care. Food is mostly always wrong. I had a to go order with a long strand of hair in it! Didn&#39;t see it until I got home. Don&#39;t expect good service at this location. Go to sawgrass mall!

Finally I come around to this review. I&#39;ll start off by saying that there were no complaints. Everything was delicious, service was great, and the wait wasn&#39;t that bad. I believe we arrived around 9 PM so we probably only waited like 20 minutes to be seated in our table. They gave us a booth which is awesome especially with two little girls with us. The bread was amazing as per usual. To drink I ordered a mango smoothie, which was tasty and quite filling. Honestly from all the times I&#39;ve ordered that drink it&#39;s never come out bad lol. For my kids they had apple juice and both girls had the grilled chicken with fries. They loved it. My husband got I believe it&#39;s called chicken Marsala with rice and he loved it. I was surprised he liked it because usually he&#39;s picky but he loved it. I got a Margherita flat bread and it was awesome. I ordered that because I had already eaten a lot of bread, drank the whole smoothie, and I knew I wanted to order an epic cheesecake. Just thinking of the cheesecake I ordered is making me super excited and more hungry lol. I ordered the Oreo cheesecake. DELICIOUS. <br><br>I&#39;ve been to this location more often than the others because it&#39;s close to where I lived and I&#39;ve never had any complaints of this location. It&#39;s actually my favorite from all the TCFs. With the others sometimes there&#39;ll be a miss here and there but for this one I haven&#39;t had one. So cheers !

I came here while my car was getting serviced because I can&#39;t pass up a Cheesecake Factory at a shopping center. I thought it was great service, friendly staff, and very good food. My chicken chili and Oreo cheesecake were very tasty.

It&#39;s a cheesecake factory, so the quality is pretty consistent with all other locations. However, the speed and service were not. The hostess was unfriendly at check in and the server was nice, but not easy to locate- including when we were ready to pay the bill. I don&#39;t see this lasting in this location if they don&#39;t get their staff some service training.

Ordered take out for dinner. As I&#39;m eating I realized there was a hair in my freaking food. I know it&#39;s not mine because my hair is in a slick back low bun and my hair is blonde! This is gross and disturbing! This is my favorite restaurant but every single time I order take out there&#39;s an issue. When will they get this together!!!! So annoying at this point! I&#39;m such a regular that staff knows me by name
Stopped by for drinks and dessert after dinner and had a lovely experience. Diondre was very polite and well mannered and ensured we had a lovely experience. Great way to end our night!
Good service and great food! Extensive selection for all taste! <br>Dishes should be washed better.

Sloooow service Everytime we come. Bread arrives after the entrees. Plan to spend at least a 2-3hrs if you&#39;re coming here. Try to get there early too because wait times are out of this world.<br><br>Wish they had a reservation or call ahead system.<br><br>Their food is mostly good and you really can&#39;t go wrong with their humongous portions<br><br>Favorites:<br><br>Miso salmon<br>Kobe burger with sweet potato fries<br>Cucumber lemonade<br>Frozen hot chocolate<br><br>Brunch menu favorites:<br><br>Eggs Benedict<br>Cinnamon pancakes

This Cheesecake Factory is the only one in Pines it the surrounding area, so it&#39;s always packed and really hard to get a table on the weekends. The food is really good but a little bit over priced. The interior is very elegant and makes you feel nice. <br>They have many many choices of cheesecake and makes good for a birthday dinner or celebration!
After waiting almost an hour to sit, ordered Fried Calamari and Buffalo Blasts and they tasted HORRIBLE, with an aftertaste of burned old oil. Horrible experience, never this location again.

Decided on eating at The Cheesecake Factory for an early dinner on a Tuesday afternoon.  We were greeted at the front desk and sat pretty quickly. The restaurant was not busy at all and plenty of open tables around. We were sat in the far back, out of sight. We were given menus from the host. After looking over the menu we realized it had been quite some time since anyone had come by. 15 minutes passed and we were never greeted, offered any water or drinks and never even met our waiter. Pretty sure no one even knew we were there. 15 min of sitting and not being greeted or offered drinks is unacceptable for a slow, Tuesday afternoon. We got up and left and decided this restaurant did not deserve our business this night. The hosts were pleasant and that&#39;s about it. I&#39;m truly disappointed with the service we experienced today.

No matter how near or far I travel to a Cheesecake Factory I never have a bad meal. Their portion sizes are way too much and I&#39;m not complaining for the reasonable price. I&#39;ve been here probably 25x and I don&#39;t think I&#39;ll ever get to try all the menu items. My faves are the asian lettuce tacos and turkey sandwich from the skinny menu! I also love anything that comes with their signature mashed potatoes! Of course, the cheesecake is what it&#39;s all about. Friendly staff and you definitely will take home a doggie bag.
