This place never disappoints when it comes to food, service, and drinks! My favorite is the angel hair pasta with shrimp. (The portions are huge.)The waiters are so friendly and attentive. And the mojitos are the best around!
Always come to this location and enjoy the service and food. Enjoy the burrito and a slice of Oreo, Hersey of Reese&#39;s cheesecake.

Came by here for the third time for lunch since I&#39;ve been in South Florida, and had another funky experience. <br><br>Food was delicious as usual. I had the kale and quinoa salad and Americana burger. They actually  po it the right amount of parmesan cheese on the salad, which is typically my common complaint. The burger was done correctly, and as usual delicious. <br><br>Customer service needed alot of work. The receptionists looked busy talking among themselves, didn&#39;t bother paying attention or welcoming people walking in the door. And when we asked to be moved because the table was super small, it&#39;s almost like I offended her. It&#39;s almost like she forgets shes being paid until a certain time of the day to do her job and take care of customers. And then our waitress was my final deciding factor to leave this negative review. She was straight up rude. She obviously didn&#39;t want to be at work, and was very impatient with the time it took us to order. She seemed upset with some of the questions I had about the menu items. Bad experience there unfortunately, and I blame the hiring managers. Look for hospitable and welcoming people to hire, not just anyone to fill the space.

Let&#39;s be honest, how many years have the Cheesecake Factory been around?  Pretty much a Very long time. <br><br>When I was younger I went to the Cheesecake Factory in Aventura Mall for the first time, and being only a kid,  and  were all I cared for. But oh  boy what a horrible experience I had with what I ordered . I don&#39;t remember what I ate (not sure if it&#39;s repressed memory by now or I was just to horrified) but nonetheless, I remember telling my mom no hell No I&#39;m not eating whatever crap was in front of me. Sent it back, remember the second meal being a burger and fries. Nope, didn&#39;t happen. Didn&#39;t like it, didn&#39;t think it was normal; so we sent it back. I ended up telling my mom at a young age to never take me back to Cheesecake Factory EVER!!l (too cute, little old me)<br><br>Being a real foodie means you LOVE  FOOD, you ENJOY  FOOD at any given moment, you SAVOR  flavors and you take your time to taste, inspect, and move on with the next bite before the waiter ask you is everything ok?! Yea, it&#39;s serious business being a foodie. FAST FORWARD to 2027, In February I gave the Cheesecake Factory another shot for my grandmothers birthday, unfortunately I didn&#39;t have a choice in the matter especially when have relatives from out of the country are in town. this time around changing my location and going to the newly renovated mall center near Pembroke Pines mall. <br><br>My family and I walked in and of course we expected a time as anyone who goes out to eat in a Sunday. The wait was long nearly 1 hour, the place was so crowded, I&#39;ve seen The Aventura location crowded before but this....this was a whole new level of groups and individuals just sitting and walking out waiting for their little machine to vibrate. Finally we were seated, the place is grande, spacious, elegant with high ceilings and the atmosphere was so different than i remember the Aventura location. Changing scenery did the job.<br><br>This time. I ate like a champ, the experience was one worth enough for me to create a review on YELP (kind of reminds me of the South Park episode, when the whole town business was controlled by YELP reviewers I had the fried calamari and the Cajun pasta and we order pizza and salads and drinks, best part yet, this location has a mirror where a wall should have been separating the kitchen from the restaurants. Super clean, not quiet but the atmosphere is definitely one we enjoyed dining in.

We love coming here. We have been here on multiple occasions, from birthdays to graduation dinners, as well as, just going out to dinner and dates. The ambiance is nice it gets pretty busy on weekends. It&#39;s a bit noisy. Sitting outside is better if it&#39;s not to hot because it quiet. The service has been really good.

This Cheesecake Factory is located in the Shops at Pembroke Gardens outdoor shopping center. I like this location because it is perfect after a day of shopping. They have indoor and outdoor seating, and even on the busiest day I have never had to wait long to be served. The restaurant is spacious and clean, and the staff is friendly and professional.<br><br>As with every other Cheesecake Factory, the bread is to die for! They have a very extensive menu where you can get whatever you are craving - pasta, steak, seafood, burgers, sandwiches, sushi, Chinese food, Thai food, Mexican food - they literally have everything! I recommend the Tex Mex egg rolls if you are in the mood for a Mexican appetizer. The orange chicken is delicious and so is the Bang Bang chicken and shrimp - my favorite dish. I highly recommend if you like curried food. <br><br>Their drink menu is awesome because they have a lot of strong and fruity cocktails which I am a huge fan of. You can&#39;t go wrong with the Mai Tai! <br><br>They also have a skinny menu for meals and drinks if you are watching your weight, and they let you know of their product is gluten free or began friendly. <br><br>The cheesecake here is delicious and the serving size is enough to share. My favorites are the white chocolate caramel, the oreo cheesecake, and the strawberry cheesecake!

Variety, variety! This Cheesecake Factory now has the impossible burger! Also, if you&#39;re Caribbean, you&#39;ll love the fried plantains, they&#39;re better than most :) m<br><br>Cheesecake Factory is always a good go to. Anything you&#39;re looking for, they usually have it, in their booklet of a menu :D <br><br>Brunch is good, but is only on Sundays, And of course the cheesecake is amazing.

Other than than the wait, which wasn&#39;t actually all that bad given that it&#39;s Fathers Day and the restaurant was packed, the service and food were absolutely excellent. Mimi was our server and she was absolutely awesome. Extremely attentive, courteous, kind, witty and energetic.

This has never changed. It&#39;s sort of a bad food emporium for shoppers too desperate to go elsewhere. The service may be the worst in this capital of rude, non English speaking help (). <br>They eventually bring several menus full of the most unhealthy garbage I&#39;ve eaten in years. I was at a Cheesecake Factory a few years ago because it was next to an Apple Store and it was very much like this experience. I stupidly thought that some of the Apple might rub off, but no and this is exactly the same unpleasant experiment.<br>What really gets me is that they are too cheap to install WiFi. Oh well, it gives me an opportunity to jot down a few thoughts; I&#39;m sad to say they are all bad. When I asked for lemon I got NO LEMON for the oh so so sweet dumplings. Yuck! Nevermore quoth the raven.

The food here is great and the menu selection is vast, but the service is not on par! Our table was a party of 5 but we might as well been 15, because our food took forever, the drinks and refills were slow and the server was no where to be found. The manager never came up to apologize to us about what was going on, and this wasn&#39;t even the weekend, it was a Friday afternoon for lunch. I would hate to see how it is during busier hours!

I&#39;m not exaggerating when I say this is my favorite restaurant and I come here at least every other week. This one is close to home but I&#39;ll go to any Cheesecake Factory in any state the food is just so versatile and you never get tired of what&#39;s on the menu. I also enjoy happy hour here. The prices are very affordable. There has yet to be a meal I haven&#39;t enjoyed and the bread??? Everyone loves the bread
Food came quickly and I had a great time. Service was great and the pasta was al dente. The nachos were tasty and the toppings were on point.

It is always an amazing experience of flavors and taste. The service is excellent. Might need to wait to be seated 30 minutes in a Saturday night, but it is completely worth it.  Favorite plate Hibachi Steak, Favorite appetizer Tex mex Egg rolls
Good love the red velvet ! Haven&#39;t really tried any other kind. This is one of my favorite places to hangout at.
The food is always great. However, the service is not great; we did not appreciate how rude the waiter was last time we went there. Furthermore, any alcoholic drink will have more ice than liquid.
Wasn&#39;t a big fan of this place however glad I gave it another try. Food was better this time around.

The avocado toast is absolutely divine. I have never had such delicious avocado toast in my life. It was so flavorful and the bread it came on was steaming hot and fresh, it was absolutely amazing. The customer service was just as good as my food; the manager checked up with us a couple of times as well as our waitress. Will definitely be going back for more avo toast :) #vegancertified

I&#39;m really not a big fan of chain restaurants, however, I have never had a bad foodie experience in this Cheesecake Factory location.<br><br>Yesterday we had a farewell party for our co-worker. We had a big party, about 25 people, and I am impressed how well organized the whole process was. Especially, that they split checks for each and every individual that was seated. That&#39;s a huge plus for big parties. They sat us near the bar area so that was convenient. They have great happy hour specials and an array of cheap apps and salads that are included in the happy hour menu. Happy hour is from 4-6pm. <br><br>I ordered the Vietnamese Shrimp Summer Rolls for $5.50. It was an amazing deal and I got very full from just that alone. The roll is filled with vegetables, shrimp, and rice noodles. Its wrapped in rice paper and it comes with a peanut and spicy chili dipping sauce. The spicy chili was my favorite! I also ordered the fried avocado rolls. I cannot even begin to describe the amount of joy I had eating this amazing appetizer. You know the section of yelp that asks what the last food you were to eat if it was your last day on earth? I have to add this app in there. It was THAT GOOD! <br><br>I could not for the life of me leave the Cheesecake Factory without having a cheesecake. So I had one slice of the Chris Outrageous Cheesecake. Anyone that knows me knows that I ALWAYS leave room for dessert. This cheesecake has to be the best cheesecake I HAVE EVER HAD!!! This cheesecake consists of a Layer of moist chocolate cake, a layer of Brownie, Toasted Coconut-Pecan Frosting and Creamy Chocolate Chip Coconut Cheesecake. Who created this??? Was it Chris? I want to meet this guy and hug him! And also curse him for creating such a heavenly sensation filled with a week full of calories, fat, carbs, and sugar. Oh well, It was worth every bite. I enjoyed immensely. Total euphoria. <br><br>Trust me...order this cheesecake and you experience a slice of heaven! <br><br>PS. The cheesecake factory has $6 valet which is worth it so you don&#39;t have to park 2 miles away. Or maybe after eating here it&#39;ll be worth parking far to burn some calories. LOL!
This is horrible 1 hr wait then goes to sit us next to people when we have a small child then the hosted gets disturbed because we want a booth ridiculous then another 45 min wait. Never again
Never have anything bad to say about The Cheesecake Factory, this was my first time visiting at this location. Everything was great from the food to the service! Look forward to coming back

I came last night for my birthday. I rarely go out mostly cause I can be impatient. The wait time, the waiting for a plate, the waiting for the check. <br><br>The piña colada was weak, I barely tasted the alcohol. My plate was a cup of angel hair with 6 large shrimps. I was beyond disappointed cause I wanted to bring some home. It had a great taste but I really was hoping the portion would&#39;ve been enough to take home. <br><br>On the bright side on my birthday they had the cheesecakes on half price. The Godiva is super sweet but is awesome with milk (bought it home)<br><br>I honestly won&#39;t be returning. First impression matters.

I love the Cheesecake Factory! It is one of my favorite places to have brunch and dinner. I like this location in particular because it&#39;s closer to my job and more convenient to access from where I live. Service is consistently great regardless of when I visit, whether it&#39;s alone or with family and friends. Can&#39;t wait to come again!

I love the food and order the long island iced tea everytime. The staff is normally very nice so no problems there. <br><br>One issue that I have is the outdoor seating. I only sit outside when I come here (1/month). I love the atmosphere of the shopping center. The smaller outdoor area however is very very hot. I dont mean beacuse of the sun. Their fans are only on one speed and it does not keep you decent. I know it is outside but, this is FL. Though I don&#39;t expect cool, it was a breezy day today and I could still feel my body temp rising. My 2 yr old was miserable. When asked if the fan near could be turned up was told it only has one speed. The other area does not have a temp issue. This is the second time sitting on this side and had the same issue. I would ask to sit somewhere else if they give you this side.

We were a table of 5 plus a high chair. They broke glass and it shattered a jumped everywhere and hit my nephew- which I understand that wasn&#39;t done on purpose, but cmon -_- <br>I had a 4 cheese pasta..... idk about you, but wouldn&#39;t you imagine the pasta to have white sauce?? Not red? Then I find out the serve is supposed to ask what sauce. She just automatically assumed I wanted red. The pasta came with exactly 5 small pieces of chicken.... yes, I ordered the lunch portion. But 5 pieces of chicken? To pay for a plate that&#39;s $18, only 5 pieces????

My Grandma and I went for lunch as soon as we walked in we were able to be served. Our waiter was nice and allowed us to look around before asking us what we wanted. we settled in and ordered the avocado egg rolls for our appetizers and after ordered our entrées. I had the chicken lettuce wraps and she had a well done hamburger. <br>it was so good that we even took half of our meals home.

My husband and I visited yesterday with our toddler and it will unfortunately, after MANY visits, will be our last. We arrived around 4:30 PM for an early dinner (or so I thought), expected to wait as we typically do at this location. We check in and are told wait time is 15-20 minutes. Its borderline no can do with a toddler, but he was in a good mood and  judging by the size of the crowd, it seemed the hostess got her estimate right. Flash-forward 30 minutes later, our toddler is well-past melt down mode, I have my husband check in to see approximately how much longer for us. Not only did the hostess have our party size wrong (said we were 4 and a high chair when we were clearly 2 and a high chair) she told us we had only been there 10 minutes and it would be another 30!!!! I almost lost my damn mind. Ask my toddler if weve only been here 10 minutes!! Having been a hostess myself years ago, i understand the stress-fullness of the job and coordinating tables, especially at a restaurant like Cheesecake. But do not tell me I have been only waiting 10 minutes when its pushing 30! Time estimating is the hostesses most important job in this place, if you cant get it right, simply dont do it. They have an issue with this, as this is the 2nd time in a row this has happened to us. <br><br>Needless to say, we put the beeper back on the hostess table and left, PO&#39;d, hungry, and with a crazy toddler. Thank God theres plenty of other places to eat here.

I don&#39;t normally go this location due to the distance but when I do, they don&#39;t disappoint. I went on a Sunday &amp; it was crowded but we got seats for 7 people in less than the wait time we were told which was 40-50 mins. Got a table outside and our waiter was very nice. Our water was quick to get refilled &amp; all the food came out hot. The bill came out in one check but our waiter didn&#39;t mind splitting it up &amp; did so with a great attitude. This place is so convenient as the parking (if you&#39;re lucky) is literally a couple steps away from the entrance &amp; there&#39;s shopping all around before or after your meal!
Waiting time for first como first 45 to 50 minutes <br>Delay at the entrance dish came with all together. The waiters was wonderful all time . I do appreciate that i will be back soon

I&#39;ve never been a fan of The Cheesecake Factory but no doubt, they make the dopest desserts. I decided to give TCF two tries, once for dinner and a few days later for their Sunday brunch at this same location, and neither of these visits disappoint. On one of my visits I ordered the Four Cheese Pasta which comes with penne pasta, mozzarella, ricotta, romano and parmesan cheese, marinara sauce and fresh basil (you can add chicken). I was delightfully surprised this dish didn&#39;t taste overly cheesy. It was a nice comfort food that hit the spot. I kept hearing about their Sunday brunches so we decided to come back a few days later and I ordered a Cinnamon Roll Pancakes and O...M...G... So good! I think brunch was the biggest hit for me, along with their signature cheesecakes.

This is by far the WORST !!!!! We spend more than an hour waiting to be seated , the hostess giving us every attitude. When we tried to speak to them to see another alternative they just didn&#39;t care or wanted to help . We were a party of 9 with four kids .

Me and 5 coworkers hit this location up. We were all pretty pleased. The portions were a nice size and we made happy hour so the drinks were on special and really good. We did the avacado roll, spinach dip and stuffed mushroom. No complaints. I had the 4 cheese pasta which was okay being Italian I should of known that pasta isn&#39;t their specialty so no blame there. My friend had the chicken with cheese and asparagus now thats what I should of done! It was very good. The best part was the cheesecake...dolce de leche! It was ridiculously good! Espresso was blah...order American coffee. The server was very good! Im sure Ill be back.
Always a good place to eat, but why don&#39;t they offer a dairy free cheesecake?! So many places have that option. Could have been a 4 stars if only.

3 stars today as food was great but service severely lacking.  Took much too long for food to arrive &amp; when it did, 1 Order was wrong.  Took an additional 10 min for corrected order to arrive.  Manager couldn&#39;t be bothered with checking on diners as he walked the floor.

Delicious food but service not what it&#39;s like at other locations.<br><br>I love food, which makes it easier to love the Cheesecake Factory. Who in their right mind doesn&#39;t love cheesecake?! Even people with dairy intolerance love the stuff, but today&#39;s visit left me wanting better service.<br><br>Our party of five arrived, placed our orders... Every one got their food except for me, I waited 10 mins till I was finally bright my food. The chicken piccata is my favorite, it always gives me a smile on my face and in my belly.<br><br>When dessert time came around I ordered a cappuccino to go with my cheesecake... Again, everyone received their drinks, I waited... And waited till I was able to flag down the waitress to remind them I didn&#39;t receive my cappuccino. We finished the cheesecake before my cafe con leche arrived pipping hot, so hot I burned my tongue... Lucky for me I was able to enjoy the cheesecake while I still had taste buds.<br><br>We informed the waitress that we didn&#39;t receive the cappuccinos we ordered but instead cafe con leches, she change our bill &amp; took mine off (I left almost all of it since I didn&#39;t want my party waiting for me to finish the cup of lava I was served)

In the past I was never the biggest fan of this restaurant but maybe I was not choosing the right plates.<br><br>I came this time to celebrate my best friends birthday and I will admit I really enjoyed it.<br><br>I ordered from the Skinnylicious menu, the avocado and chicken sandwich which came with a salad. My best friend has pasta and she also ordered some avocado rolls which were really good. I was very happy with what I ordered, it had so much flavor and the avocado was fresh.<br><br>We also ordered dessert. Oreo cheesecake!!! It was to die for. I dont nornally do cheesecake but this was just way too good.<br><br>I think I will give this place some more chances and try new things more often.

When you have the dish in the name of your chain, you really only need to do that one dish properly to keep people coming back.<br><br>The Pembroke Pines Cheesecake factory does this EXACTLY.<br><br>PROs: Red Velvet cheesecake was AMAZING per usual. <br><br>-They were even kind enough to split a slice so I could share it with my coworker. I don&#39;t know if this is a company wide practice as some sites will do it without a problem but others end up being a bit confused when I request it.<br><br>Cons: Other foods were disappointing.<br><br>-I was dining here with some coworkers. I got a sandwich and fries while they ordered more complicated dishes. One coworker got the fried mac and cheese as an entree. They did arrive with the other entrees but they were cold. While I have no proof, I assume that they were prepared to be sent as an app, read the ticket and kept the dish back and sent it out with the other entrees. My other coworker got a salmon dish that was unmemorable other than the fact that the taste of the salmon was completely masked by a mess of &#34;herbs&#34; and butter. (I tried A bite and didn&#39;t ask for more. She did not finish it either.)  <br><br>As a prologue, I REALLY HOPE THAT THIS HAS BEEN FIXED BY THE TIME THIS IS POSTED:<br>-I went to the restroom. In the ladies&#39; room, there were 2 stalls. I opened the door to the handicapped stall and saw it was occupied by an older woman with a walker. I tried to apologize and she said it was ok as the lock was broken. I have to wonder how long it had been like this without any one noticing such an easily fixed problem.

Super disappointed at this place. I&#39;ve been to other cheesecake factory and food was delicious. At this location, portions were tiny and super greasy. I have the alfredo pasta and it was a bath of oil. Chicken was dry. Tuna was nicely cooked but there were 4 small pieces. Please go to others cheesecake factories since they are so many in FL. The mall is nice, a beautiful strip with stores on the side. Nice for a stroll.

We had a Great happy hour experience. Drink and apps  for $5.50 4-7pm and the drinks are strong! The waitress was awesome, we only had an hour til our movie started and she got us in and out with 15 mins to spare! Will be hitting this spot up a lot more!

I have been at the location since 7:30 it is now 9:12 and I still have not received my order. I told<br>My server Adam that I would like a a New York strip steak and a side of shrimp scampi. He first came<br>Out with a bowl of scampi sauce and I asked what it was for. I told him again that the shrimp scampi doesn&#39;t come like this. He cut me off and said I got u I got u. He then brings my meal out with scampi sauce all over my steak. I smiled nicely and said no this is not what I asked for. He then said do I want this or should he take it back and make it all over. I said this isn&#39;t what I asked for so I&#39;m<br>Not going to eat it. The manager comes out very aggressive trying to confirm my meal and says NY strip with grilled shrimp with scampi sauce. I tell her that is incorrect I don&#39;t want it grilled. She then says that&#39;s how it comes I said no it isn&#39;t I come here all the time and you guys make it happen. She then says well that&#39;s gonna be $30 is that ok? If I said I come here all the time I&#39;m pretty sure I know the cost. I would just like my food. It is now 9:20 and still no food. This is absolutely outrageous. I have been very patient waiting here for my food. My family ate their entire dinner without me and I was the one who suggested this place. Definitely will think twice about coming back with the service I received today.
Good place but for some reason sometimes is great and other not that much (talking about the food and service)

Cheesecake Factory please make the French onion soup the way it&#39;s supposed to be made! What you are serving is not French onion soup but simply sauteed onion soup. There&#39;s nothing French about it!

What can I say that everyone doesn&#39;t already know about Cheesecake Factory, majority of the plates are enough for two people, to eat the dessert first or you won&#39;t have enough room, which would defeat the purpose in going to a place that has some of the best cheesecake. #redvelvetcheesecake

Came here for a date night and really loved my pasta and drink! the wait was a little long but that&#39;s to be expected, overall I really love the cheesecake factory and recommend for couples or families for a nice night out!
Always a great place to go for whatever reason. Great for the wife and kids, weekends, the in laws.
When I have birthday party to celebrate I go there, love the chicken marsala, the pasta and the service excellent. Love the decorations and everything there. Good food

Service here is getting lax and the food is getting inferior and costly for the wait time. My food was mediocre, however the patron next to me waited almost 45 minutes for chili. You know that&#39;s not happening. I got the gumbo on rice and was disappointed; it used to be tasty, now if just bland. No longer worth the wait time too many other places to compete for my dollar.
Having a great time at Cheesecake Factory,  Pembroke Pines!  our server Jennifer is been outstanding!! Best ever!!

I love eating here. One of my favorite things to order is the chicken potstickers. This time one of the things I ordered was a Greek salad with the olives on the side &amp; when they brought our food the olives had been mixed in, when we revived the salad remake there were no olives (olives on the side) at all.

Yes the portions are ginormous and tasty, but the service is why I give this Cheesecake Factory five stars. We received genuine hospitality. First our table was too small; no problem whatsoever. It was taken care of pretty quickly. Then our one and a half year old was becoming super cranky.  I was ready to take her outside when a manager came over and offered a cookie to help us calm her down. She was super sweet and it was completely unexpected. Thank you for making our experience great!

I came here this past week with my family to celebrate my nephews 12th birthday. Although the food was good and the waiter was great. I was embarrassed by the fact that the waiters put absolutely no type of effort in singing happy birthday to him. They sang happy birthday and just blew it off, walking away immediately as if it didn&#39;t mean $#!+ to them. I know sometimes this task could be burdensome but I feel like sometimes you have to fake it for the customer. I feel like next time if it&#39;s somebody&#39;s birthday, you should gather the ones who would put a little bit of more effort and make it more meaningful.

I absolutely love this restaurant. I always want to go here. But i am very disappointed with the false advertising of this yelp profile. My husband was trying to step up a dinner for my 30th birthday and we have a very big party and when calling he was told that you do not accept reservations. We have a party of 15+ people and this profile states that one of the features of this restaurant is reservations that is obviously false. Very disappointed.

The Pembroke gardens location always has a wait on weekends but it&#39;s usually half the time that they estimate upon arrival. Went for Sunday brunch In a group of 5 - the food is consistently good, the service was sufficient considering it was busy, and all of the orders came out correct.

Food is pretty good but will not return due to the rudeness of the staff. The hostess give you incorrect wait times then get upset when you ask about the wait time. Was told I would wait 1 hour and a half and ended up waiting closer to 3 hours.

Out of all the food chains restaurants, The Cheesecake Factory is definitely my favorite. This particular location is located in Pembroke Gardens Shops where you can grab a bite or a drink after a day of shopping. I think this location is also good for any occasion, like a family gathering. There is always a line, expect to wait about 30 minutes to an hour. <br>I feel that every single item at Cheesecake Factory is good, no matter what you order. I&#39;ve had many items on their menu and they&#39;ve amazing. I&#39;ve tried their mac and cheese balls, one of my favorites, small portion good enough for 2. I&#39;ve tried their egg roll sampler, seared tuna, nachos, burgers. As far as entrees, my favorite are the steak Diane with mashed potatoes. The steak is like a filet, it&#39;s so soft and tender and the sauce is amazing. I&#39;ve also tried many of their pastas, carbonara, jambalaya, shrimp pasta, and even spaghetti with meatballs. I haven&#39;t had any complaints, food is always solid good. I&#39;m giving them 4 stars because of the wait times, service really depends on your server, and parking is so limited.

I&#39;m here at the restaurant with my wife celebrating our anniversary of marry and with sat down to enjoy a nice dinner and the food came to the table and my wife meat was wrong with ask for medium and the brought it medium rare with ask the server to fix it they take the plate to the kitchen we wait like 15 minutes and they brought the food back to the table and they didn&#39;t to anything to the food I&#39;m a chef and I know how to cook and they didn&#39;t do ANYTHING to the plate and was cold not right. We spoke to the manager and she said that for that Steak awill take 15 minutes for a hibachis steak come on and then with wait 20 minutes more for them to bring the right food. I will no come back to this location the made my celebration a nightmare.

Cheesecake has a huge menu, as you know. Something for everyone. <br><br>This particular one i came to around 10pm on a Thursday. place closes at 11pm. The hostess didn&#39;t even make eye contact with us while talking and checking her phone. Inside was bit too cold for my linking. The menus were greasy and dirty - with so many pages and so many menus, I would expect they rarely get cleaned - and when they do, it&#39;s probably with dirty rags. that part alone disgusted me. <br><br>The food was... meh. Cheesecake Factory food. Same ol same ol. Not one of my favorite places. Cf is a cheap-date, at-least-I-know-what-I&#39;m-gettng place. <br><br>The cheesecake is good though! Go for that!

I give you 1 stars do to the fact the we ordered for take out and I got there before time so my food can be fresh. Well the aguacate egg roll  was soggy and nasty <br>My steak Diane had no flavor so mushroom and sauce  was extra watered down the meat had no flavor maybe it was my fault for no looking in the bag before departing the restaurant.but I will  NEVER ORDER FOR TAKE OUT AT THIS LOCATION ITS HORRIBLE ..  $70.00 just wasted ..

I went to Cheesecake Factory in Pembroke Pines for lunch on a rainy day spending $17 keep in mind the day before i spent $26.00.  I placed the order online and pay for faster pickup. when i arrived the server at the pickup desk stated it will be $5 more since i modified my order per his manager Chelsea who was close by.  Now i have no issue paying extra if i was notified upfront however Chelsea the manager showed no empathy just proceed to ask for the additional $5 which immediately ticked me off so i told her no thanks and left without considering how my refund would be processed. i called the store spoke with her in all the conversation she stated she did not mean to upset me put i can place another order that i am financially comfortable with ooooookay (just tick me off even more) so she expected me to wait another 30 minute for a meal don&#39;t think so!  As a leader she SACRIFICED a good customer experience + $17.00 for $5.00.  (i recommend your employees to read &#34;The 6,000 Egg by I went to Chik Fil A and spend $9 got a quick lunch and GREAT CUSTOMER EXPERIENCE

Lazy managers, lazy order takers, lazy chefs. Greek salad by CF menu is GREEK SALAD 380 cal 6.95<br>Feta Cheese, Tomato, Cucumber, Kalamata Olives, Red Onion and Vinaigrette<br><br>Where do you see Greek salad FULL of lettuce? There is NO Greek horiatiki salad with lettuce. <br>But the chef insists on pumping up the already tiny portion of Greek salad with lettuce. You see it is less expensive than the other ingredients. And of course if you ask them not to put any lettuce in - they will. Lazy order taker, lazy manager who does not oversee and lazy kitchen who do not learn. Thank you once again for nothing.
Good food and service...the wait time was shorter than normal, only about 20 mins. Drinks were on point too!!

Well it&#39;s a chain and I&#39;m not big into chain restaurants but their  food is pretty good. I can&#39;t say I&#39;ve always had a great meal, there was one time I ordered chicken enchiladas . They were just ok, not something I would order again. Everything else has been really good, the dish I love and order often is the Tuscan chicken. My favorite. <br><br>The service has always been good, they are usually very attentive and friendly. They also are well versed on the dishes and able to answer any questions I&#39;ve had. <br><br>This last trip I tried their cheesecake, I know it&#39;s called Cheesecake factory and after 5 visits it&#39;s the first time I ordered their cheesecake. Omg it way heavenly, rich but delicious. <br><br>Cheesecake factory has an insane amount of items, I&#39;m not sure how they pull it off but they really do a great job.

I love their mango &amp; chicken avocado salad. Out of the ten (or more) times I&#39;ve ordered the salad, something is always missing. Either there&#39;s no avocado  or there&#39;s no bread .  I&#39;m not sure why they are always cheating me of something (by not giving me everything I&#39;m paying for), but it makes me wonder what else Cheesecake Factory skims customers on. <br>While I enjoy their salad, I wouldn&#39;t recommend this store. <br>If I already know before checking the bag that not every thing I ordered is in it, then this is clearly not a good store to buy from.

A bit pricey. But the portion are more than filling. The place always seems to be clean and the service is fast. The lighting is a bit dark but overall, the place is nice. <br><br>They are always busy. Apparently, the cheesecakes are the only thing that comes frozen. I still think they taste better great. The Oreo cheesecake is my favorite (it might be called cookies and cream).

Normally....I&#39;m not a fan of big chain restaurants, today was the best service and food at cheese cake factory, Oh yes you heard right. Our server Sarah was exceptional and attentive. Our food (based on her recommendations) was phenomenal. Definitely returning and asking for her!

I used to remember when the Factory actually put all passion and love into making cheesecakes but over the years it&#39;s gone down the drain. When I visited I would always order the Lemoncello torte (cake) which always come with a side of juicy sliced strawberries and rip cream. I would always mix the cake rip cream and straw to get a savoring flavor that I would never forget. But over time their quality in food drastically decreased. They not only cut smaller portions of the cake for the same price but they serve less rip cream and even stopped cutting their strawberries. I actually had to take a knife out and start cutting them myself. The strawberries weren&#39;t even juicy anymore they had been completely dried out; I assume the company does this to make the fruits last longer and save more money, but overall Cheesecake Factory isn&#39;t as good as it used to be one star. PS here&#39;s a before and after picture of the cake I usually order. In the after picture I had to cut the strawberries myself.
The service and food is always great every time I come. However, I have one small complaint...I wish they would just soften the damn butter!!

&#34;Cheesecake&#34; is one of our go to places. We can usually count on the good and service to be top notch. Yesterday, this was not the case. When we arrived, we got a table immediately. The hostess told us that was because it was cold out. <br>Our server was a guy that seemed in a rush. Both my son and I emphasized that we like our French fries brown/well done. I got the feeling he wasn&#39;t paying attention. After a half hour we still didn&#39;t have our food, but we had received two bread baskets. A woman came to our table to say she would take over our table. She reeked of cigarettes. We hate cigarette smoke. We asked if the order had been put in and she told us that was the case. We still waited, and after a while some food arrived. The fries looked like fast food fries. Not to Cheesecake Factory standards, and definitely not brown as requested. We asked the server to get them browned a little more, and also for the other ones to come out brown. When two more servings of fries came out, they were not well done...<br>There were more mistakes and more waits. We ended up waiting for the check over 20 minutes. What a disappointment. They probably had the B team working.

We waited way to long for food and that would be fine if our server would had come and accommodated to us. And we ask for our pizza to go and it still took forever. Ruined my date night with my husband.
Amazing like always! Love the pasta and bread from here! Took my co worker here for her first time and she had an amazing time! I hope to come back soon!

Service can be spotty but overall it still offers the widest variety of choices, decent portions and top quality ingredients for generally reasonable prices. <br>I had an excellent turkey burger on a great brioche bun. Not the most imaginative selection but it&#39;s safe to say if you want any type of burger you&#39;ll be satisfied with the results here.

The salmon crusted salad is bomb when it&#39;s made right... the only reason I&#39;m giving this location any stars is because the take out ppl are so kind... but anyways so I have ordered the same thing everytime at this location because it&#39;s the only thing I really love and fits my health needs... every time I order this salad it&#39;s missing ingredients like the chef just doesn&#39;t know what comes on the salad... or they are out of stuff and try to pull one over on you. This is almost 20 dollars for a salad there should be no reason why half of my ingredients are missing... every single time... you&#39;d probably say stop coming to this location but it&#39;s literally the healthiest thing I can get near my job... smh... someone please help because the other Cheesecake Factory&#39;s DONT PLAY ABOUT QUALITY...

There were so many people waiting outside, I thought for sure there would be a long wait. But the hostess said for 2 it would be 15 min, and then we noticed an open table at the bar so we grabbed it-no waiting! Awesome, server promptly brought menus, took drink orders, and within 5 min I had my wine, ice water and bread. We decided to try &#34;fried macaroni and cheese balls&#34; sounds a little insane, but my daughter wanted to try it so we ordered it. Four big balls of Mac and cheese, coated with breading and fried, served with a cream tomato sauce, not too bad.<br><br>For our entrée, decided to split the teriyaki chicken, substituting mashed potatoes instead of rice. Omg those potatoes are amazing!! Perfect consistency and texture. The chicken was cooked perfectly, and the teriyaki sauce was just sweet enough!  So filling, had to pass on the cheesecake dessert! Oh well, maybe next time!

I usually love the food at the Cheesecake Factory, but this one is just not as good as others around town. This place is always super busy so plan ahead if you are coming here. Thankfully we arrived before the dinner rust and didn&#39;t have a wait. The staff was great and the service was great.

This place isn&#39;t what I remembered it being. Most of my favorite items are gone and items that are still on the menu tastes completely different. Having a waiter like our waiter today didn&#39;t help either. Never once did she check up on us. Or refilled our water.

So we sat at the bar , had to come too the area for a gift. So we decided to eat here . When we arrived Lindsey was here . She was fantastic attentive sweet and fast!!!! We like coming here the food is usually really great today they&#39;re really off. My neighbor at the bar order chicken sliders from happy hour and said they tasted like the fish batter , my scampi wasn&#39;t as lemony as it usually is . Want a great time today . Lindsey left and Jill is pleasant but too busy for one bartender at happy hour !!!!!!! Gonna give it a break .

After shopping in the heat all we wanted was some air conditioning and food and beer.  The Cheesecake Factory has such a huge menu even when I have know idea what I am in the mood to eat I can find something here. This location seems to be one of the better ones.  Every single staff member was super friendly and they were working so hard non stop.<br><br>Our server was great. We started with some beer and we ordered an appetizer of zucchini, mushroom and avocado fries which came with two sauces. They were delicious.  I think I would come back just for these again.  Super fresh, very lightly breaded and the two sauces were excellent.  One was a garlic aioli and the other had a spiciness to it. <br><br>Then I ordered the cheese steak sandwich and my daughter had the spicy chicken sandwich.  The cheesecake sandwich was bland, no real flavor and the meat was quite tough. I took plenty home for hubby to eat.  My daughters chicken sandwich was very good.<br><br>The prices are fair, portions are huge, and the food is fairly good. Thumbs up for the staff here, they give great service.<br><br>I am not a cheesecake fan but walking past the case of all the fresh cheesecakes almost had me ordering one.  I didn&#39;t but they had some very pretty looking cheesecakes.

Came in to use our gift cards. Ordered today and was pleasantly satisfied  with our orders<br><br>Avocado,zucchini,mushroom fries. Great  appetizer. Diane steak medium , amaze balls! And teryaki chicken. We left content and sadly with no room for dessert this time.<br><br>Also the decor and restaurant are lovely.

Our server was good, a nice young lady but I was disappointed in the fact that we sat down before two table that got served and left before we did. But the food was good we definitely enjoyed that just not the service entirely.

Oh Cheesecake Factory....I haven&#39;t really been disappointed by you on prior visits, but today was no good. <br><br>My sister and I decided to visit for lunch (normally I go for dinner). I ordered the factory nachos and my sister ordered the orange chicken. My sisters orange chicken was very good-served with veggies and brown rice. Great flavor. <br><br>Now, lets talk about the nachos.....when the waiter put the plate in front of me I was hit with a horrible stench of stinky cheese (and I love cheese). The nachos were burnt and the chicken, which costs extra, was sparse. Omg it was bad. I am not the type to turn a plate away but this was so bad I had to call the waiter to please take it away-and FAST! <br><br>I asked for a turkey bacon avocado club sandwich instead and was much more satisfied. <br><br>By the way their strawberry lemondade is fantastic!
Love this place <br>This is what you call a 5 star restaurant. Had a great time during happy hour, service was a little slow but it was packed so it was expected <br>Will be back

I had the Grilled chicken tostada salad. If was awesome!. It actually has two chicken tostadas under the large bed of greens! . It is delicious and very large. Highly recommend this salad. It has perfect amount of a light and delicious dressing.

We went their for a celebratory lunch, there were 6 of us.   The service was extremely slow. Not to mention that they missed bring out one of the orders.   The food was fine but they could have been more attentive to water and utensils.

The waiter charged my card MORE tip than I had initially put. His service was very sloppy. He was supposed to split the bill between my friend (who paid cash) and I, but instead he ended up charging my card for the entire transaction and took my friends cash as his tip. When we told him about it, he looked clueless and corrected the mistake, but he also gave himself an ADDITIONAL tip on my credit card that I did NOT authorize. <br><br>When I called to complain to the manager, he said they would refund my money and another manager would be contacting me. However, I never received that refund and no one has contacted me since. Very very disappointed.
Went here friday night and our server was Barry, he provided us with amazing service! What an amazing guy, give him a raise! Food was amazing and delicious. Would definitely recommend

I like going here because it&#39;s super close to home, the wait isn&#39;t usually very long and the cheesecake of course is to die for. My last time there this past Friday kind of ruined it for me, the service was adequate but the food always seems to fall short. My husband ordered the Louisiana Cajun pasta and I feel like the cooks are drowning the food in oil because when his big bowl of pasta arrived it was like we were eating liquid grease out of the fryer. I ordered a side of Mac &amp; cheese, the quality of the cheese must be extremely trashy because again oily and greasy. Also had the fried avocado, zucchini, mushroom fries, and they had a nice crisp crust thankfully. After such a disappointing meal I had no desire for dessert and won&#39;t be going back to waste anymore money on oil for dinner.

So, we always have a problem with where to go on Sunday&#39;s as everything is packed. My wife suggested The Cheesecake Factory. I didn&#39;t even know they have breakfast. We arrived just as they were opening, was seated right away, and didn&#39;t have to wait long for Breakfast. The meals were plentiful, hot, and very tasty.

For some reason,  everything we ordered was horrible.  My Cobb  salad was wilted and brown,  my friend dynamite shrimp was soft and tasted rubbery.  The service was ok.  Overall,  not pleased and I&#39;m hungry.

I arrived early and asked for a table. They gave me a beeper... when it&#39;s sounded I was late 5 minutes and they told me I have to wait additional time or longer even after I waited close to one hour once the beeper was given to me on the beginning ..... I believe this was unfair especially when I was coming with my grandmother to dine in.....The person on the front desk call her manager which had a terrible customer service and with a very unpleasant attitude.... I would re-educate in customer service the person who manage the front desk of this Cheesecase Factory at the Shops in Pembroke Pines....  very disappointing as I am or were a regular customer here.... with so many options I will take my business elsewhere.

After hearing rave reviews of The Cheesecake Factory, this New York native finally got to taste and see what everyone has been crazy about. Too bad, I had to go all the way to Florida to make this visit happen. I hate the pages and pages of menu items. As a first-timer, it took way too long for me to browse and decide. I mean, really? If your menu is not between 2-4 pages then we have a problem. Then again, I guess it is a &#34;factory&#34; right, but not just for cheesecake. <br><br>The bread was yummy. I ordered the island grilled chicken which was delicious. When it comes to grilled meat, you usually run the risk of winding up getting served a piece of meat that is dry. Luckily, the kitchen staff know what they&#39;re doing, because my chicken was still moist and flavorful. As a Caribbean, I wasn&#39;t too happy with the small spoon of brown rice on my plate. However, they do tell you what to expect in the description. We were stuffed. Since we arrived just an hour before closing time, there was no room or time for dessert. The prices were reasonable too.<br><br>The decor in the restaurant and the bathroom were divine. It&#39;s a great place to dine and host events. Very elegant and classy. I will definitely be back for more.

My family and I sat down to eat here this evening, after a long time of avoiding the restaurant due to our previous visit. This time around we had a wonderful time. Service was fast, and we had a great dinner. The chicken carbonara was delicious! I highly recommend it.  We all tasted different cheesecakes.  We loved them all, except for the original one which had a top layer of cream cheese. We scrapped the top layer off, and then the rest of it was fine.

Don&#39;t really come here for the food often but I admit the cheesecake here is phenomenal. The take out line takes forever on weekends so try to come during the week to avoid all the waiting. I like it that they have a &#34;skinny menu&#34; where you can order food that&#39;s easy on calories.

If your order take out be prepared to wait at least 45mins - 1 hour. I&#39;m not sure if they don&#39;t care about take out at this location or what but it is a very long wait compared to other Cheesecakes around the area.
Just had dinner here, Abraham was my server. He was great! I work in the service industry and his hospitality and service was exceptional! The food was great! Had a lovely little dinner !

I love this place. It&#39;s a restaurant you go to when everyone in your group wants something different. The menu is huge and there is a wide variety of foods to choose from! My favorite is the chicken and biscuits.

Whatever the people at Cheesecake Factory corporate are doing to have this chain of excellent restaurants succeed the way they are, they&#39;ve succeeded again. <br><br>Yeah, you&#39;re going to pay a pretty penny for some good food. But it&#39;s worth it every time. Given that the menu can and has always been overwhelming with the almost endless selection of dishes, it makes it difficult to choose. But overall, they hit it on the mark with great service, food, drinks, decor and atmosphere.
I like Cheesecake Factory, the food Is good and you can enjoy a Yumi yumi cheesecake of whatever you want. The place is nice, but not for children I think.
Can never go wrong here. A wide selection of food.  The desserts are amazing.  Around the holiday the pumpkin pecan is a must

We went on Fathers Day and it was a 2 hour wait! We did have a place to sit while we waited and there were stores around to shop in so it actually wasn&#39;t to bad. We were seated and our waitress was very tentative. We had a large party and she was able to keep up with the entire tables needs. I hadn&#39;t been to the Cheesecake Factory in so long and the menu has changed I was able to still order one of my favs shrimp scampi even though I didn&#39;t see it in the menu. The food was great and of course the cheesecake was awesome!

This was a good find I was meeting a friend in Pembroke Commons for lunch. I noticed there was a cheesecake factory that popped up on my yelp. I went for lunch there was a ton of parking available. The service was good, and I like how they have lunch size portions.  Since this area is full of chain restaraunts that are all fairly average I figured I couldn&#39;t go wrong with a classic like cheesecake factory. Although, one thing I noticed there salad dressing over The years has changed it is definitely not as fresh as they used to be. They defiantly are buying they already made.

Food is always great here and David, our waiter was extra friendly and helpful.  However we waited over an hour for a table and we were with my grandma who is 90 and in a wheelchair.  And still they made us wait, and wait and wait. <br>Parking was hard to find. Next time I will go to another location

I love this place but the last two times I wasn&#39;t to happy. Three week ago I wasn&#39;t happy with food at pembroke mall and yesterday at sawgrass they took forever for the food. The service is amazing

So we had a dinner night with the wife and the kids. There was an obvious wait that they said would take about 20 min. It only took about 10 minutes. They took us to our table and we were introduced by sebastian and his new trainee Carlos.  He took our order fairly quickly! My daughter ordered a Shirley temple, that did not taste right so they had replaced it. Carlos came back to check on us all the time and he was wonderful and a great server. He was very professional and he will be a great asset to this business. Great job to him, i see him with great potential! Thanks

Other than the usually long wait, I love every single thing about The Cheesecake Factory. They have great appetizers, great entrees, delicious cheesecake and good service...and great free bread. <br><br>Favorite appetizers: Tex Mex Eggrolls, Avocado Eggrolls, Fried Mac &amp; Cheese, Buffalo Blasts, Thai Lettuce Wraps and Sweet Corn Tamale Cakes. <br><br>Favorite Entrees: Chicken Di Pana, Caramel Chicken, Orange Chicken, Spicy Cashew Chicken and the Monte Cristo Sandwich. <br><br>Dessert: Any and all cheesecakes. <br><br>You just can&#39;t go wrong here.
Our host was wonderful! We sat outside and I had the tomato basil and mozerella cheese pasta, which was yum!

If you&#39;re trying to come here for a fast business lunch - make sure you tell your server so they can rush the orders... it doesn&#39;t hurt if your party already knows what they want too. This place is in a busy strip mall and it can get packed fast.<br><br>This Cheesecake Factory isn&#39;t anything different than any other one. Good food, good drinks, good service. Can&#39;t really say anything bad about this place.

We met friends here Sunday for Brunch <br>Got there at about 10:30. No wAit at all<br>Our server was fantastic!!<br>I ordered Eggs Benedict opted for the spinach and tomato version <br>DELICIOUS!!!<br>Did I mention the best tasting coffee??<br>We will definitely go back and try another tasty treat!!

Cheesecake anyone ?!?! <br><br>The food is okay, the typical assorted American/italian/ healthy plates, but those cheesecakes are fire! There&#39;s not one I have tried that has disappointed me. We like to order the spinach dip- it&#39;s one of the best ones I&#39;ve had. If you&#39;re a fan of chicken Marsala stay away from it here, the sauce is to acidi (hope that makes sense). <br>The pork chop plate and seared ahi tuna are both delicious: highly recommend to try it.<br><br>Normally, I go to the location in Pembroke shops, but it doesn&#39;t matter which one you go to it&#39;s always super busy. The restaurant is big with a wide range of outside seating. One comment would be for the amount of capacity the restaurant sits, the bathrooms should be bigger. <br><br>To end your dinner on a happy note, try the white chocolate raspberry cheesecake it&#39;s a crime LOL!

I have been to this restaurant a few times and this last time I was not a fan. We were place out side to dine which was fine. However the sun was blinding anyone facing the sun and when the shade was adjusted, the people not facing the sun backs were burnt by the sun. This is a poor design. The waitress was very nice and tried to accommodate us but there was nothing she could do. They need to resign the shade/awning to keep their patrons from dealing with the sun. The food is ok. I will say the drinks were good.

Poor service! Took an hour for the food to be served for a small party of 5 and the the quality of the food was definitely NOT worth the price. Even after we complained to the manager, he did nothing to make up for this horrible experience. Shame on this establishment for this lack lust experience!!!

The Cheesecake Factory can never go wrong. Disregarding the extensive wait on a busy night, Cheesecake&#39;s menu can satisfy any taste buds. In all effort to comply with dietary needs, food choices range anywhere from steaks to burritos. With so many options to chose from you will find yourself coming back to devour the menu.

Writing this as I&#39;m still dining in! Came in tonight, a Thursday night with my family of 5 around 7:45 and was sat pretty quickly. I&#39;m just blown away by our server Tatiana! She is so attentive and on point with everything. I&#39;m in the restaurant business myself and when I see great service I truly appreciate it. Definitely give Tatiana some praise and a raise! Lol thank you cheesecake of Pembroke gardens.

I used to love this place for their huge selection of good items and prices . It seems that there was something for every taste . And their desserts oh my , oh my cheesecakes and more cheesecakes . Now I must say there food quality and flavor has declined and not just a little . What a shame ! Their service is also questionable , I usually go to the one in Boca and it seems that if you come during Happy Hour  you won&#39;t see your server again  after your first drink and apps . I might give it another chance but it&#39;s been miss, miss, miss the last three times I have been here . Like I said what a shame I really used to like this place .

In a flash: GREAT, I love their cheesecakes! Kind of overwhelmed with the diverse menu, but food was still good quality. Service definitely fluctuates from the times I&#39;ve been here. <br><br>Top favorite cheesecakes: Red Velvet, 30th Anniversary, Kahlua, Oreo, While chocolate raspberry and banana cream pie. <br>No matter which Cheesecake factory I go to, the quality of their cheesecakes has always been consistent.<br><br>Come here for the cheesecakes and get it to-go.
Had the chicken and biscuit meal and I loved it. The place is clean and spacious. Will go often.

This place gets better and better,,, fuller and fuller! Billy Ray was fantastic! Had the Chinese chicken salad that was awesome.. but those skinnylicious lettuce wraps get an A+!!!! That brown oat bread... keep away if you are watching your weight!!! Once you eat a piece. . Its all over!!! You can easily eat a whole loaf!!!
Awesome experience our server was attentive to us.<br>Food was great but the best part is always the delicious variety of cheesecake

I love Cheesecake Factory and this one is good for location and convenience. The food is always delish and same decorations as others since its franchise, however, the service here is okay compared to others. Staff has improved with service, efficiency and politeness. It is always packed here weekdays and weekends. A 3-star as it is Cheesecake Factory, nothing fancy or extraordinary.
Good service and good food. Consistent in all of their locations. We always get tamales, and salmon and salads. The black bread is amazing and dulce de leche cheesecake to die for.

Visited the Resturant on a busy Friday afternoon, I haven&#39;t been here in a long time and there was absolutely no parking space. Literally all of the spots were taken, so after driving around hunting for a spot I dropped of my gf at the front door. Finally found a spot and the place was slammed. We found seats at the bar and we were debating wether or not to wait for a table and I&#39;m so glad we decided to stay at the bar. We met Marissa she&#39;s the bartender of the night and let me tell ya she was on fire. She attended everyone and every drink order that was being placed. She handled every request swiftly with accuracy. <br><br>She immediately got our drinks, that amazing bread and put the baseball game that we requested. She was a little energizer bunny, TFC you have a very valuable asset and it was a delight watching her perform. Extremely friendly, we got to know that she&#39;s an eagles fan, recommended the specials for the night and made sure our drinks were topped of. Again all while this place is slammed with people everywhere. <br><br>Moving on to the app we went with the avocado rolls, much better than the ones from bj&#39;s. Not spicy and they deliver the taste. For the entree I went with the Caesar salad and my gf went with the steak tacos. We asked for extra cheese on the side, a few lemons and balsamic vinaigrette and the girls in the back were also on their game.<br><br>I will be coming back and recommend this place very highly for their service/quality keep up the good work, and make sure to take care of Marissa even though she&#39;s not a dolphins fan ;)
Great place to have a meal, but careful with with the white bread you may break a tooth, waitress was so nice ! Jan 5 2015.

I come in here for lunch EVERY Monday with my co worker and always get the chicken Alfredo and it&#39;s so delicious! Who ever the pasta cook is on Monday is amazing because I&#39;ve been there on a Tuesday and it&#39;s definitely not the same. Can you release the name of this cook?? I&#39;d love to have them be my private chef..the pasta always looks so pretty when it&#39;s served which is a nice touch also. Love this place

I enjoy dining at this Cheesecake Factory after church for Sunday breakfast. The service is really good and the food is great. My son enjoys the blueberry pancakes. My daughter enjoys the pasta and I&#39;m always switching it up. Everything is always on point and the Manager is really cool!

Our server Abraham was awesome we told him we had to be out by 430pm and he got us out by 430 pm his recommendations were excellent and the service was great. Even with the rude male hostess everything was amazing.

Love this Restaurant!They give nice warm multi-grain bread, have great fresh food that has labeled the calories your getting. I love the skinny menu, my fiance loves the Alfredo pasta they serve with added cheese by the server in front of you. The cheesecake factory is great for a romantic night out, birthday, or special occasion. Lovely outdoor tables with accent candles. The bar has a great selection of drinks :) And of course my favorite cheesecake is the red velvet and  some strawberry&#39;s on top. Yummm<br><br>If you haven&#39;t been here it would be worth your time.
This restaurant is always busy and you have to wait for 30 minutes to dine, but the food is good and the service is exceptionally.

One thing I do hate is how I always get too full to even be able to eat any cheesecake! My advice, order dessert first! <br><br>This is a great place to go out and celebrate, just be prepared to wait on the weekends.
Besides the scrumptious, oh so delicious cheesecakes,   the food is tasty and the service is awesome.

The Cheesecake factory is a chain restaurant and a good one.  The menu is gigantic which means there can be really long waits for ordering, especially in big parties.  Good place, good food, good service! also it probably goes without saying, but try the cheesecake.

We came after church on Sunday and I was elated that they had brunch!! It was good, I had the crab hash. It was just good though. My bf and his mom got the eggs Benedict and they said they would have liked if the eggs were a little runnier bc otherwise the dish was a bit dry. My mom got the Baja Chicken brunch option, and it was good. Their mint tea was so refreshing. Our waiter was super attentive and kept bringing me refills.  I&#39;ve been here two other times and always think it&#39;s good but never understand why they are always so packed. I loved the Oreo cheesecake, a definite must try! Overall everything was good. It&#39;s worth checking out but there&#39;s always a wait so if you&#39;re really hungry, you&#39;re better off hitting up Fuddruckers or something else.

Service was ok. As usual.. The place is very loud. It&#39;s difficult to have a conversation with the person across from you.<br><br>Food wasn&#39;t bad but wasn&#39;t great either. My shrimp in the lemon and Garlic skinny pasta were very overlooked. My husband had the Asian salad and the chicken was missing. There were maybe three thin slices of chicken.. Deli chicken.

Everyone knows the Cheesecake Factory is where it&#39;s at! Amazing!! The cheesecakes, even better!!<br>However, because it&#39;s always so packed, the wait sucks and the service isn&#39;t that great since the waiters aren&#39;t very attentive. If they up the service, it&#39;d be perfect

After waiting for 2 hours because we had such a big group, once we sat down we were with an amazing waiter Jamie she gave great service!! I definatley do recommend to come!! <br>Even with the 10 other tables she still gave us the best service she can

This place is delicious everything on the menu is great and everything is served fresh. I go here all the time for lunch and dinner but my favorite is the sunday brunch. Great location accessible to shops nearby you can make a day of it at this location. The staff is exceptional!

Shitty place almost slipped and fell twice when I walked in! Told the hostess who said &#34;oh sorry I know&#34; what&#39; the hell ?! Then when we were seated at our booth there were flies at the table from the dirty table next to ours. Disgusting! The utensils were on the table and didn&#39;t looked washed. As we were walking out the floor was Slippery (no surprise) told our waitress Jamie who didn&#39;t seem to care that anybody can slip and get hurt. <br><br>Should&#39;ve gotten up and left and when we got up to leave had to hold on to each other and walk out. I don&#39;t know why we even stayed. I&#39;m pissed and the cheesecake even though it was delicious couldn&#39;t even make up for it. Aventura location does not disappoint from what I can remember.
Great good, great service.<br>Love the chicken Madeira and Chicken Picatta<br>I want to try the whole dessert menú lol
The steak tacos were really good, I&#39;m not a fan of Cheesecake Factory but I was surprised I actually enjoyed the food. Prices are ok.
Great for &#34;HAPPY HOUR&#34; Strawberry Martini / Tuna Tartar and Crab Bites ! Get in early to beat the dinner crowd.
It&#39;s hit or miss, sometimes it&#39;s great other times it&#39;s okay. I had the sante fe chicken salad it was okay. The waitress was friendly.

The 2  hostess they have working are horrible for seating arrangements.  We are a party of 3 and we&#39;re passed over several times.  When I asked them they said, &#34;we seat bigger party&#39;s first&#34;.  I told them it&#39;s not fair that we were told 20 minute wait and it took 54 minutes to seat us; only after in requested to speak to the manager.  The food is consistently good and service was average.

Awesome place, with excellent food, great skinny menu (lighter fare) and cheesecake to die for, but THEY DO NOT TAKE RESERVATIONS!!! They seat you in the order you check in, so if it looks busy, either valet that car or drop someone off to put your name in!

The date was friday 9/19/2014 the purpose of the visit was to celebrate a friends birthday. I expressed this to my waiter and clearly stated to him that i would like for him to sing to her, who did not sing to her or even wish her a happy birthday.   before I left I told him when we decided to leave I asked hey did you forget my request  he said yes without any apology or remorse.  <br><br>This is/was my all time favorite restaurant.  Whenever I visit I know what I will eat i ordered the Jamaican black pepper shrimp dish it comes with plantains, they failed to put it in my plate so I asked for it,  the waiter  brought it out 10min later. The beans were cold so he brought new ones those were so salty I was unable to eat. <br><br>The poor service and quality in food preparation of this establishment is very discouraging and frustrating.
I used to love Cheesecake Factory but now they are ripping customers off by making their cheesecake slices smaller. I got a small slice of cheesecake for $8+ which is ridiculous.
Ordered the steak medallions for takeout; what I received was extremely disappointing and unappetizing. Would not recommend.

Food is delicious and never a disappointment. I recommend the factory burger, Cajun chicken littles, or the steak medallions from the skinny menu. <br><br>For appetizer you must try the avocado egg rolls or hummus :) <br><br>I&#39;ve honestly never tried a dessert I didn&#39;t like here! <br><br>Took off a star because service is always lacking.

Ive been to many cheese cake factory reasturant locations.  This one has always been tge best in wait staff, freshness of food, and preparation.  The patio can be a bit sunny at the end of the day, and tgeres a tendency for pigeons. <br>I had the Farfalle with chicken and garlic. Its the best pasta dish on the menu!
I love The Cheesecake Factory and I love this mall. So every time I have the chance to come I really enjoy myself. Good food, nice place.

Where do I begin? The floor was so greasy it was like walking on a Slip n Slide. Not greasy in one spot - nasty greasy from the waiting area all the way to the table. While the service and appetizers were good, it took forever to get our entrees. One of our drink refills  had to have something in it because the server made a face  just as he was going to set it down on the table, said it looked funny, and took it back to the  kitchen. Two meals were cooked improperly and were taken back to the kitchen, so two of us sat there and watched our companions eat their dinner. Our food came out after everyone else was done eating. The only bright spot here is they offered a few complementary slices of cheesecake to make up for all of the mistakes. The cheesecakes were absolutely divine.

The last time I was here the guy took our order and never came back till he brought the food which was like 40 minutes or so later . One of the people we went with his water had finished and this guy just disappeared. The service is not the great . This is why I barely come here but my daughter insisted to come . They need their waiters properly trained maybe they should ask lime  because their service is amazing by their staff . I&#39;ve never had any complaints and always wondered how they train their staff because of the great service ...

Julios, was an excellent server. He recommended new items and was very attentive.  I hope I spelled his name right.  Anyway it took us about 30 minutes to get a seat but once we sat down the servicing to pretty quick for men. My son had the BBQ Burger and I had the four cheese pasta with chicken. The meal was pretty standard despite the prices. You can always expect if you&#39;re going to The Cheesecake Factory that the prices are going to be pretty steep the portions are pretty huge so you get what you pay for however if you want to save on cost split your meal. There&#39;s enough for two people when you order so this should be simple we had the crab bite appetizer now let me tell you this was the first time that I had this appetizer and it was delicious I will definitely order this again. I think in the future if I go to Cheesecake Factory I will just stick with appetizers I would not get a whole meal I never eat the whole thing and I usually always end up caring take out containers. If you never been the cheesecake before please expect to bring your wallet and at least spend $70 for two people if you&#39;re ordering appetizers and a drink you can cut the cost and make it about 60 if you take the drinks out LOL. Cheesecake is a great go-to restaurant however Pembroke Square Gardens where it&#39;s located is overcrowded and hard to find parking but I guess it&#39;s all apart of the package.

Always a good spot for a small plate menu item or try one of their entrees. You won&#39;t be disappointed. Just make sure to keep some room for the delicious cheesecake. My favorite is the dulce de leche with extra whipped cream and brickell ( not sure how it&#39;s spelt) enjoy!

In reviewing the Cheesecake Factory, what can I say that hasn&#39;t been said by anyone else in the world? <br><br>I almost got it.... nope can&#39;t do it! <br><br>This chain restaurant delivers good food. There isn&#39;t anyone that can argue with that. The menu is massive and they give their customers the opportunity to choose what they would like to indulge in.  Like one of my fellow yelper stated in her review, other than there phenomenal cheesecakes the food isn&#39;t enough to make you come back. But I find it so interesting that everyone comes to celebrate something here. It has to be the dessert menu!

The most disgusting greasy floor! As you get seated you will noticed trying to balance yourself from not falling due to the grease floor your walking on. What a hazard and liability this place bringing my family and kids! Is your kitchen in the dining room? Management should be fired for even allowing this. I can only imagine how your kitchen is. You guys want 15% tip? I&#39;ll give u a tip &#34; Clean your disgusting greasy floors&#34;!

Love coming here, the food is always good. Great service. Nice place and really nice ambiance. The only thing is the wait is pretty long but once the food comes, its definitely worth the wait. Everything on the menu is amazing.<br><br>My favorite thing to order are the chicken pot stickers
The service isn&#39;t best. The quality of food is definitely not as good as the aventura location.It could&#39;ve been better,disappointed.

I went to The Cheesecake Factory with my fiancé and was there for 2 hours while all it took us to eat our food was less then 20 min. They took forever to give us our appetizer I understand it is the kitchen that taking long but they could have told us 20 min into it that it was gonna take a while. They then brought the main course to us fast because it was already done waiting for us. Once we were done eating it took 30 min for us to see our waiter. I was not even in a bad mood this was just bad service. The manager even came to talk to us about the food taking long and they did not even give a type of discount. I will not be coming back and I will worn everyone I know of this bad service.
Do you know typical commercial stuff you get what you pay for massive amounts of cheesecake selections for the better of the commercial food chance I guess

I love their menu, the cheesecakes are amazing (pumpkin pecan is awesome)  I usually go for pasta dishes, absolutely love the chicken romano pasta.  The bread is really good, my favorite is the brown.  The only drawback with this place is that it usually has a long wait time and they don&#39;t accept reservations.  However, at this particular location I always end up visiting the near by stores while I wait and this makes time fly by.  Overall have had a good experience at this location.

I do not recommend the Cheesecake Factory in Pembroke Pines.  The food is terrible. Years ago I visited this location for the first time for a birthday event.  I ordered a dish that I typically order at the Aventura location.  When the food came, it was disgusting.  I swore off this location.  Recently, however, I was in the area and had a craving for Evenlyn&#39;s Favorite Pasta (which I have had before at Aventura and loved it).  I decided to get it at the PP location out of sheer convenience and because I figured that enough years had passed that perhaps the quality of the food had improved.  I was wrong.  By comparison to the Aventura location, it was again terrible.  I will never buy food at this location again.

I love the Cheesecake Factory... It&#39;s pretty consistent every where you go. Went here for a graduation dinner with a party of 10. It took about 2 hours to be seated so we walked around the mall. If you know you&#39;re going to have a large party, be sure to come two hours in advance to get your name on the list.<br><br>The kids menu is pretty large but only has one healthy option.<br><br>If you are trying to watch your weight or eat healthier, the Skinny Menu is amazing.

Had our anniversary brunch and it great . It was called the brunch combo served by Juan. He was very professional &amp; attentive. highly recommend the pancakes. The space is. If ever you are in Penbrook Pines I strongly recommend you check them out

Steak Coulette with Sweet Potato fries... Great seasoning and good size portion for a healthy meal. Good customer in a great location were parking can be challenge but at least you don&#39;t have to pay for it.

Arrive at the factory with a group of 3. It was very busy but it didn&#39;t take long for our group to be seated.  Our waitress was great got our drinks immediately and took our order. I ordered the shrimp scampi, my teen daughter ordered the shrimp and sausage pasta. My friend had the soup of the day which was a chicken tortilla. My friend didn&#39;t like the soup she said it was to salty when it arrived. My teen liked her pasta with the sausage and shrimp. My daughter and friend ordered a lemonade my daughter had the strawberry and my friend had a cucumber lemonade. They bother said it was extra sweet and had to get a cup of water to dilute it.  I like the service but didn&#39;t like the food. My pasta on the shrimp scampi was dry. There was not enough sauce on the the plate to coat the pasta.  I was eating dry pasta and choking on it. I didn&#39;t even eat 25% of the pasta because it was dry and choking to swallow. I didn&#39;t like my meal. That why I gave this place a 3 star. The service was great.
By far my favorite location,While Aventura is closer I&#39;ll take the drive for better service. My waiter Monday Night was Issac he was great! Very attentive.  Food was  fresh &amp; delicious.
Place always busy, Great food light on the wallet 4 ppl with drinks 140$ bucks. I love the Classic burger and a mojito to go with it. <br>You Won&#39;t be disappointed..
Loved the service and the food. My server was very attentive and even brought us hot towels.

Cheesecake Factory food is always good.  I don&#39;t like this restaurant at all because they always keep it too cold.  There is no reason the patrons have to be so cold that it is completely impossible to eat inside.  The temperature last night inside the restaurant was unbearable. I don&#39;t understand management that allows that to happen.  Clueless

I&#39;m only giving this 3 stars because my food was amazing but I wish I could say the same about my server .. He made me feel rushed and gave horrible service. Not to mention when my pasta came he never asked if I wanted cheese on top
Melanie and Nicole were awesome! All smiles and great customer service! I really enjoy this location and will definitely return.
Food was pretty good but the short blonde bartender needs to check her attitude at the door.  2nd bad experience with her -- Not friendly at all !           Won&#39;t be back anytime soon!

Love this place, been coming for years. Could have sworn I did a review before but whatever. Anyway, this place is ALWAYS busy so be prepared to wait. The food is always on point ! And the cheesecakes are to die for ! I always get the tiramisu every time, can&#39;t go wrong. I&#39;m in love with their fresh guac &amp; chips, also their Cesar salad is amazing as well.
Pretty tasty food and great staff! Loveee the Mac and cheese balls delish! The wait wasn&#39;t that bad either for a Sunday afternoon 20 minutes for two people.
