If you are willing to wait - and I mean wait - then this place is perfect. Great food, in the middle of a great shopping strip, and very friendly service. But, you will be here for hours.

This cheesecake factory is always busy! The food is consistent but the service is not. Went in for takeout today and observed a manager texting on his phone for five minutes while the takeout area was overwhelmed with customers waiting.  I should&#39;ve taken it as a bad sign when I called and was put on hold for five minutes just to place my order.<br><br>Most corporate restaurants like the cheesecake factory usually have extremely high standards regarding customer service, it is unfortunate that this cheesecake factory seems to be lacking in that area.<br><br>One other problem we have experienced at this particular location which is disgusting, is that the people who were serving the cheesecakes were not wearing gloves and were pretty much sticking their fingers into our desserts. My husband was picking up takeout watching this occurrence and he asked them if they could put on some gloves and pack up some new desserts for us, which they did without hesitation. But I don&#39;t think a customer should have to ask for people to be sanitary when someone is handling their food.

I&#39;ve been compelled lately to give a few restaurants a second chance that have had a most unfavorable review in the past.  After my experience today...the first thought that came to my mind was &#34;YES!  Now THAT&#39;S the Cheesecake Factory that I remember!&#34;  Wow!  What a difference!  My review is based on an experience on a Monday around 11:30 A.M.  My waiter was great!  He made sure that we not only had a good experience, but he also gave good suggestions.  It was a VERY HOT day and I wanted something frozen, lite, and sweet.  He recommended that I try the Mango Smoothie. I had no idea that Cheesecake Factory made smoothies.  The smoothie was perfection in a glass.  I could not stop talking about that smoothie.  It was everything that I wanted and so much more.  I had the avocado egg rolls for an appetizer.  They were fresh, well prepared, and creamy. Loved them!  I ordered the chicken piccata as my main meal.  It was really good.  I&#39;m not sure if this location is under new management or if they have a new cook...but it was SO MUCH better this time around.
What can I say, this place rocks.  Thy serve from salads, to pizzas and filet mignon.  Great for big parties with a variety of items in their menu

Love cheesecake fac, can&#39;t go wrong if your undecided, it&#39;s the go to place.  Even on vacation somewhere, don&#39;t know where to dine,  eat the cheese! Love the bread, love the apps, really good fish and chips actually.

The avocado rolls are usually sure to please. They were sour tasting and not quite what I remember. The flatware was dirty with spots and fingerprints the 2 paper napkins I received had something gooey on them. On the upside I won&#39;t get fat being tempted to eat here again.

This place is one of my favorite restaurants to eat at. They have a very large menu and each item I get is very satisfying. I recently went there on the first day of school as I usually go somewhere every first day of school. My daughter Kayla loves their spaghetti and meatballs!!! My wife enjoys different appetizers which usually gets her very full. I always start out with a green mint tea which is soothing. I choose from the Fish and Chips, Cheeseburger, or one of my favorites Chicken Picatta.  I always try to save room for one of my favorite cheesecakes the vanilla bean!!!!!! That&#39;s one good cheesecake especially with a cup of coffee. My family and I enjoyed the meal,and will mist definitely be back. I remember when they first opened up in Pembroke Pines back in 2011.  The food continues to be great and the service continues to be top notched. I look forward to coming back to Cheesecake Factory to try another delicious item.
Disappointing meal. My wife ordered a burger very well done and it came out pink and cold. My daughter ordered tacos and they came out cold as well. Used to love coming here but not anymore.

Got to restaurant at 1250. Told us wait was 20. Waiting 45. Sat down, 20 minutes to get water and bread. Gave us a bogus story about the decaf coffee. Ordered two waffles to make it easier. 40 minutes later nothing. Walked out. Get your customer service better people. Extremely upset pregnant women. Never coming back! Always the same thing with this place. Ridiculous. Either hire more staff or stop trying to over pack your restaurant. Clientele is far more important than the green. Greedy!

Consistent, good food, perfect portions, and a friendly waitress that gave us all the time we needed to catch up while trying to choose from the menu that is actually a spiral bound book of delicious meals to choose from.  Bread basket of sour dough and sweet wheat.  I had the full portion Carlton salad it was fresh, tasty, and exactly what I was in the mood for during our lunchtime visit. My friend had the creamy Chipotle pasta with vegetables.  We saved room for dessert, and wow, the tiramisu and white chocolate raspberry cheesecake slices were dreamy.  Try the passion fruit iced tea, it&#39;s refreshing.

Came here tonight before s movie , we come here at least once a month. But tonight the service was a bit off. We had the same waiter as last time we were here figure to give him a second chance. He&#39;s not very attentive and he always seems very rushed when it not even that busy. I ordered my usual garlic noodles with chicken. Tonight it came out with bite size pieces of chicken rather then the usual chicken on the bone. So I sent it back, waited about ten minutes later for it to be made, brought it to me with no apology, no discount nor checked on me after that. An apology would have been nice but he totally disregarded the situation. Other then that the food is always good here so we come back, just next time I hope I don&#39;t get him again. Everybody knows the food is good here and prices are a it pricey but the food is so worth it. The chicken potstickers are also amazing.

Went and had dinner here... I have eaten at other Cheesecake factories before and have never received the sub-quality food that was provided at this restaurant.<br><br>I ordered the teriyaki chicken &amp; the rice was cold &amp; hard... Literally... I could not cut through the white rice with my knife.... After complaining to the waiter, she brought me some &#34;fresh&#34; white rice... However, sadly to say it must have come from the exact same batch.  I was extremely disappointed &amp; will not be visiting there again... At least not for anything other than the desserts which were good.

Ordered the Four Cheese Pasta with chicken. It came out with 2 chunks of chicken and had the waitress take it back. The next plate arrived and it looked delicious and actually had an abundance of food. When I took the first bite, it had a freezer burn taste. The manager came to the table and I explained the problem. He defended his restaurant by saying nothing is ever frozen; completely missing the point of the food having an odd taste. Another person in my party had the same dish and it tasted completely different from mine. The manager continued to explain how nothing is ever frozen, again missing the point. Horrible experience.

Our server was great!!! But the floor was rather slippery and hard to walk and the entrees came out too soon while we were still having the appetizers. The food as usual delicious, but we have to work on the timing and the floor is an accident waiting to happen
What can I say this place is still pretty damn good despite being a big chain. ask for daniel W waiter his great. try the shrimp scampi/ steak diane AMAZING best dish on the menu
Food is hit or miss. Overdone or too salty. Wait is hours long. Two bathroom stalls for a huge restaurant is ridiculous. There are plenty of other places that are better.

You can never go wrong with the Cheesecake Factory! Talk about not knowing what to chose, a million and 1 things on the menu it feels like. Any cheesecake factory is always crazy packed but always for a reason, this place is good stuff. Service is always quick and everyone is nice, especially my Server Michael! What a sweet guy! I love lemon drop Martinis and they always make a yummy one, happy hour is good stuff too! What I love the most is the Skinny menu, they actually have a whole menu dedicated to low calorie low fat meals, that is my all time favorite thins about the cheesecake factory! Overall this place is great food is good service is good and location is great! Shop for a bit and eat eat eat! <br><br>P.S <br>My favorite thing on the appetizers is corn fritters TO DIE FOR!

Cheesecake Factory never disappoints! Their menu can be overwhelming but there is something for everyone! Light plates are my Fav ESP the lettuce wraps (a healthy option). Kids corn dogs are a hit for the little ones and plenty other options for them. <br><br>Expect to wait at any time of day it is always busy but they have call ahead!<br><br>Consistency is the name with this chain restaurant. The food, atmosphere, drinks and of course desserts are a delight. If you haven&#39;t been here at least once do yourself a favor and stop in for a drink and bite you won&#39;t be disappointed (remember this place is busy almost all the time so plan accordingly).

We got there at about 9pm so it was pretty dark as you can imagine. We chose to sit outside because that was the shortest wait but I really regret it now. The lights they had outside were tiny so they didn&#39;t do much to illuminate  but that wouldn&#39;t have been so bad if they actually worked. I looked all around and half of the lights weren&#39;t working at all. We had to use our phones to look at the menu. We told our waiter and he said he couldn&#39;t do anything about it. Okay but can you move us to a table with working lights? Or inside? I didn&#39;t make a fuss about it because I was with my family but I can&#39;t believe management at this location would be so careless. Oh and it was raining hard. They did lower these curtains to keep the rain out but our feet still got wet even when it was all the way down. I also felt like the staff took longer to serve us maybe because they forgot about us? Don&#39;t eat outside guys.

I really like CF but this one is always so packed. The one thing I really like is that the service is always good, which I really appreciate. Overall I would say that its a good food option and always get good food.

I&#39;ll start by saying I love the Cheesecake Factory. The food is delicious and portions are very generous. However this location is very busy and its its own worst enemy. Wanted to have dinner on a Tuesday evening, we called earlier in the day and were told that they don&#39;t take reservations. Ok, Tuesday night, not Friday or Saturday, maybe it doesn&#39;t get that busy. We got there around 7pm and were told we&#39;d have a 2 hour wait time! No thank you. It&#39;s not that good. We ended up getting a slice of cheesecake to go (which still took 10 minutes) and went to another restaurant in the same complex. A restaurant this busy needs to take reservations

I love coming to Cheesecake Factory - it just never gets old for me.  My favorite entree to order here is the Pasta da Vinci. The portion sizes are very big so you can share and still get pretty full. Last time I ordered the Sheila&#39;s salad lunch portion and it was delicious. This is a great place for lunch or dinner.

If I could give it zero stars I would. Tonight at this location I ordered the lemon-herb roasted chicken which I have ordered dozens of times before. They gave me chicken breasts covered in a sauce. This is not what the dish should be at all. It should be half a chicken roasted. I called the waiter over and his response was &#34;I have no clue what that is&#34;. That is not exactly something you want to hear from your waiter at all. The manager came over and apologized and offered to make me something else. So I ordered the chicken piccata which my sister also had. It was pasta and chicken drench in this oily mystery sauce instead of its normal lemon sauce. They also did not offer to take my plate off the bill after the entire issue. After returning home, my sister ended up getting sick because of the food. This is possibly the worst experience I have had at a Cheesecake Factory and I will not be returning.
I always enjoy their pasta and appetizers. My favorite is Red Velvet Cheesecake. Great service.

Love the cheesecake selection! ....and that&#39;s about it.  If it wasn&#39;t for the cheesecakes, this would just be another rundown restaurant. The food selection is diverse, but most of the food lacks flavor. The prices are pretty high and the portions are just alright.  I like coming here, as the ambience is gorgeous and the servers are pretty nice. Other than that, it&#39;s just ok.

Bad service and experience. At this location parking is bad, the wait for a table was over an hour. After we were seated waiter shows up after 20 to 30 minutes. We placed our order, the appetizers were wrong and the main meal was wrong and cold. Plates were returned twice for both couples. Waiter would disappear 30 minutes or more. Food took for ever to reach our table. We arrived at 3:30 PM and we finally got our check at 6:20 PM. WILL NEVER GO TO THIS FACTORY. I give this location a ONE because there&#39;s no ZERO.

Very disappointing experience at the Cheese Cake Factory last month. We saw a live roach roaming on top of our table and on the wall next to our booth. The manager acted like nothing happened. Won&#39;t come back.
I do Love this place and whats up with these people REALLY? I been in a few states I have did try on and its a HUGE line in the North Bay of SF CA or Marin CA or East Bay CA!

Tremendous. Outstanding. Delectable. Chicken Marsala...thai lettuce wraps...and Smores cheesecake...maybe some strawberry lemonade too. Never disappoints. Go early because it gets packed but for GOOD reason.
Very bad service, how they can said they do not have bread to serve, and food took more than 30 minutes to come. We just decide to leave and eat in other place. Very disappointed!
I have a special love for Cheesecake Factory!  <br><br>Good food, great atmosphere for a girl&#39;s lunch, birthday celebration, a date night...just about anything Cheesecake fits the bill!

The food was delicious! The service was terrible. We sat outside (it&#39;s so nice out). Our waitress was HORRIBLE. Her &#34;friend&#34; also sat outside l and most of the waitress&#39;s attention was on the friend.  She never introduced herself, messed up the food order, and drop the check on the table as if she wanted to be fired. Her and her friend talked it up as if they were on the beach. The server ate from her friends plate and held chunks of food in her mouth. Professionalism is no longer required to work at Cheesecake Factory at The Shops. Go for the food.

Went in for a late lunch date for my girlfriends birthday around 4:30pm on Wednesday so the place was fairly empty compared to the usual busy crowd on a Friday night or even the weekends. We were sat down quickly and attended to on a regular basis which was nice, since the service can usually take much longer depending on the time of the day. We ordered the fried mac and cheese balls as an appetizer and got them cheap since it was happy hour. They were delicioussssss, it brings 4 balls so we split two a piece, nice crunchy outside layer with the gooy goodness of the mac and cheese (P.S make sure to have them with the marinara sauce on the plate). For our late lunch she ordered the four cheese pasta w/o chicken (optional) and I ordered the fettuccini alfredo w/o chicken (optional as well). Let me say the food was delicious! A nice creamy and silky fettuccini pasta with the perfect mix of alfredo sauce, scrumptious. The serving size could seem a bit small to a person with a huge appetite but it filled me up. Now for the four cheese pasta, it&#39;s served with a ball of ricotta cheese so it is recommended to stir it up in its entirety as the plate of pasta is steaming hot. The four cheeses were definitely present in the pasta and the flavouring was perfect.

Great service! Great food! I am alwayas amazed at how you can eat at different cheesecake factory restaurants and if you order the same plate, they will be almost identically. This one is very spacious, it gets crowded, but only on weekend nights, abd it has tables inside and outside. The shopping center is very nice also. <br><br>I always try a new plate, this time I tried the skinnylicious three soft chicken tacos, if you&#39;re not too hungry is an excellent choice, they are great and are a healthy option. <br><br>As always the food is excellent, the portions are huge, the prices are great, and the service is fast and friendly. <br><br>Recommended!

The cooks at this location are noticeably bad compared to the other cheesecake factories. However I do want to say that the service is outstanding. If they found a way to get their chefs to be as talented as their waiters, this place would be a 10/10 no doubt.
If you want to wait a lot and be treated poorly. Come to this restaurant. I&#39;ve been in other Cheescake Factory and all are good, but this is horrible service.

The wait for pretty long but it was the day before valentine&#39;s day. They it said over an hour but it was less :) we sat at the bar and had a drank while we waited and it was nice.<br>I got the steak and salmon combo, it was a good enough portion to have leftovers, too.<br>MELVIN was our waiter and he was really nice and made sure we had everything we needed. <br>It was a good experience.<br>I love cheesecake factory!!!
Great portions of food and everything is made fresh. I highly recommend the Thai Lettuce Wraps!!!
Thai lettuce wraps are to die for!!! Oh, and the stuffed chicken tortillas as well!! The plates are huge, so I always share
Excellent service and wait staff.  Had  the seared tuna tataki salad and glass of chardonnay.  Of course, had to splurge with a yummy mango key lime cheesecake.

I love the decor and atmosphere but it is very busy and noisy. The menus are super decent. I love the miso salmon. I crave it couple times a year. And the passion fruit tea is a 5 star tea! I come here for the tea and couple of entrees that bring my cravings back here again and again. Waiters and waitresses are friendly!

I came with a party of 10 for a surprise dinner for my friend. We got here at 4:10 and said it would be at 5 and were told they don&#39;t take reservations, but it would be 45-50 minutes so it would perfect. They called at 4:40 and we were walking in from the parking lot. By the time we got inside they gave our table away and were told we had to wait another hour to an hour and a half even though we said we were walking in. The manager, kelly, was extremely rude. She would not accommodate us. One of the hostess, Christine, was super nice and tried her best to accommodate us. If it wasn&#39;t for her we would have left. As for Kelly, she was unprofessional and ride and should not be manager.

Extremely disappointed. We came here on half price cheesecake night because we love their cheesecake. We were (surprisingly) seated right away but soon realized that it was because, contrary to their &#34;half price cheesecake&#34; rules, you really didn&#39;t need to dine in to get the deal. There was a long line of people at the cheesecake counter throughout the duration of our meal.  When it came time for us to order our cheesecake from our waitress (who was very nice), they apparently sent her to the back of the line of about 40 or so people waiting to get it. After about 15 minutes she came back and apologized for the delay, citing how busy they were. Then, when the cheesecake finally arrived, it was about half the size of the cheesecake we are usually served in this restaurant. Now I understand half price cheesecake day. I guess you get what you pay for.

We enjoyed our food and the atmosphere. I would not recommend this place to families with small children as both my best friend and I have little girls. There was nowhere for us to change their diapers in the bathroom. They should think about whether they&#39;re going to be a family oriented restaurant or not and should make it clear that they don&#39;t have changing stations in the bathroom before you sit down!
Sat down the waiter asked us what we wanted to drink and never brought the bread also I ordered chicken Alfredo and got shrimp Alfredo twice and gave us mean look

I ate here for my father&#39;s birthday and the food was fantastic and the service was even better. They had my favorite cheesecake and the price was very reasonable. I am going back for my birthday that&#39;s for sure.

It&#39;s The Cheesecake Factory...you should know what to expect.  I got the Fresh Vegetable Salad with Chicken, and it was exactly what a expected.  It had a good mix of atypical salad vegetables with pomegranate salad dressing.  The service was good, and I have no complaints about this place.  I would definitely get this salad again.  The serving size was perfect and it&#39;s only $13 dollars with the chicken.  It&#39;s a good lunch time meal before or after a day of shopping.
Love the shrimp and chicken gumbo! Must try the newest cheesecake flavor, Lemon Meringue! My new favorite!

This place has always been good when I&#39;ve gone but it does get busy! The wait usually isn&#39;t too long for lunch on the weekends but I recommend making reservations no matter what time u go if you don&#39;t like to wait.

This was our first visit to a Cheesecake Factory. We are big fans of &#34;The Big Bang Theory&#34; tv show so were excited to finally make it here. It was a Friday night so, as expected, it was loud and crowded. Our wait was only 20 minutes which wasn&#39;t too bad. The menu has a lot of items. I must say that the service was quite slow. Our server was very friendly but everything, including our water, took a very long time to reach us and we only got one type of bread because apparently they hadn&#39;t baked any more. Of course every item we asked about, we were told was terrific.  Everyone in my group was less than excited about our dishes. The taste was plain and not well seasoned and for what we ordered was very overpriced in my opinion. I&#39;ve had better in local diners. The only saving grace for this place is because all the desserts we ordered were fantastic. I ordered a Strawberry Shortcake which was huge and very good. I guess they should have just stuck to desserts. I will probably not return as it was a disappointment.

I pride myself in saying that I try to stay away from big-box restaurants .. and instead challenge myself to find places that are a bit more unique or that I haven&#39;t tried yet. But there&#39;s something about The Cheesecake Factory that&#39;s comforting...in a stuff-your-face-with-4,000 calories-kind-of-way.<br><br>It&#39;s really hard to find a place to grab a late (post-10pm) dinner in the Miramar/Pembroke Pines area.  The first time I tried that... the restaurant we ended up at had run out of most of the food, and served us cold dishes.  So it was back to square one.  We ended up at Cheesecake because out of 3 restaurants we checked in the Pembroke Gardens shopping area... it had the shortest wait.  Sorry, but it&#39;s the truth.<br><br>So glad it worked out that way.  Our big group could have a conversation (as opposed to the loud-as-a-nightclub RA sushi), and we didn&#39;t have to wait over an hour (like at The Pub).  We had a great server... who kept really good tabs on all of our drink orders (and 2nd rounds).   We gorged on the fried mac-and-cheese balls (!!!!), avocado eggrolls and all sorts of main dishes.<br><br>I will end it by saying that no matter what time of day it is, or what diet I&#39;m on... I will always order a Peach Bellini with my meal at Cheesecake.  <br><br>Trust me on this one.

A standard Cheesecake factory. You can never go wrong with the food. I tried the chipotle pasta for the very first time and loved it, the waiter made a great recommendation. One of my friends at the table had to wait a long time for her food but the manager came out to apologize and comp&#39;ed the item. That right there is a great example of service recovery. Other locations should take note of that. We would never complain for an issue like this but she went above and beyond to do something she didn&#39;t have to. We came at 10 PM on a Sunday night, one hour before closing. At no point did we feel rushed and our server was excellent.

The shops at Pembroke Gardens. Great food! We were there for my mom n dads anniversary and ours. It was quite late so we simply went for some quick appetizers-we had vietnamese shrimp and avocado  rolls. Great!  Also had original cheese cake,  carrot cake cheesescake n capuchinos. We have been there many times. Great service n great staff! Jessie was very friendly n took some pics for us. Great job!  Thank u.  Keep it up!  Maggie.

My husband and I have been here a bunch of times. We&#39;ve had good and not so good experiences but I&#39;m basing this review off of our last visit. We went a few days ago (Sunday night), and it was pretty busy. We had to wait but it was less than 20 mins so not terrible. We had our son with us (toddler) so sometimes we avoid places with long wait times but we had a gift card we wanted to use. We sat down and our waitress was super attentive, unfortunately I can&#39;t recall her name. We ordered pasta and fries for my son and it literally came out in less than 5 mins, I was shocked. My husband and I were like are you sure? Lol. Our food followed less than ten minutes later. Every thing was delicious and perfect. We had plenty of bread and refills as well. I just really appreciate a place that gets the children&#39;s food out quickly, because a hungry toddler is a cranky toddler and it can make the whole dining experience frustrating. I hope our next experience is just as pleasant!

I went today to pick up a Ligurian Pesto Pasta.. When I got to work i was disappointed for what I saw. I paid $15 for this?? Really???  Pasta was hard, and I ordered some chicken for $3 extra and I counted 5 pieces.. Ordering the food over the phone they hanged up 3 times.. I&#39;ve been here before and service us great but today i feel sad because this is want of my favorite restaurants..

I am not a cheesecake factory fan. However, in my side of the world there isn&#39;t much to eat.  Being that it is a new place the hubby and I decided to give it a try.<br><br>The first time I went, we got there as they were opening so we didn&#39;t have to wait long.  I was impressed to know that they know have a 500 calories or less menu AND the food on this menu was actually good.<br><br>However, I tried going again this past Sunday and the wait was 60-70 minutes.  REALLY?  On a Sunday at 3:00 pm?  Needless to say I did not wait.  This place better get it together with their wait times!!

Cheesecake Factory never fails me!  I came here on a Wednesday afternoon and sat at the bar.  Our waitress/bartender Marissa was awesome!  She had a fantastic smile on her the whole entire time.  She was quick to everything.  The service was superb!  <br><br>I ordered the Miso Salmon lunch portion, but I swear it&#39;s a dinner portion. The salmon was cooked PERFECTLY!  I love love love the sauce with the salmon and the brown rice.  One thing I didn&#39;t like was the snow peas.  They didn&#39;t cut the top and the bottom of the snow peas.   I thought that was strange because I had to do it myself.  <br><br>If you are on a diet, Cheesecake Factory has a skinny menu for healthy conscious people!

Had lunch here with co-workers for our Secret Santa gift exchange. No matter which location I visit, they never disappoint. We numbered over 20 and they were able to accommodate us without a problem. The waitress was friendly, patient and pleasant. Enjoyed the original burger with jack cheese and fries...simple, traditional but delish!

Sandra J was exceptional! Cheesecake Factory in General is usually such a hassle because too many people dine there, but the service I received with Sandra made my wait worth while. I ordered the Tuscan chicken, my mom ordered the Louisiana pasta and we had the guacamole appetizer! Food was perfect. I&#39;m definitely coming back!
Good place to eat. The fish tacos are great and so is the red velvet cheesecake. Great place to eat.

Worst cheescake factory experience ever. I have been for over 3 hours, and have yet to get my food, i ordered a salad... A SALAD and pasta how long does it take to put some lettuce on a bowl, and boil some pasta?!. I made &#34;reservations&#34; and they still took long to seat us... dont come here if your really hungry, cause you will have to wait a long time...

I can&#39;t seem to get by that this is a chain. Training could be improved. What happened to just letting everyone eat and finish their meal before clearing the table? My poor husband eats slow as we all do..him more so,and the waitress interrupts<br>Us all to ask if we are finished...do we want dessert..and etc....all the while he is still eating and we are trying to talk! RUDE..training needed people. Dinner for 3 was about $80. And I had a hair in my dipping sauce.  gross. I would think the mgr would have suggested taking the small plate of $6.00 off the bill but he did not. Bad training and once again bad customer service...it wasn&#39;t my hair. I thought it ridiculous that I would have to suggest that they take it off our bill..didn&#39;t want to embarrass my son on his bIrthday so it will just be reflected on my not visiting too soon or at all. There are lots of restaurants in Pembroke Gardens Mall that want the business.

This is the newest Cheesecake Factory in South Florida - considerably smaller as it is located in Pembroke Gardens strip mall. The place in WAYYYY TOOO SMALL to have such a big chain there as the parking is a total nightmare. Nevertheles - we were excited to go to the barbi-doll sized Cheesecake Factory.<br><br>Wow, wow, wow is all I can say. One would think that in such a successful chain - they might have some sort or pre-grand opening training in place? &#34;DING-DING-DING&#34; - &#34;Wrong answer Johnny...&#34; So being completely fair here (as ALWAYS)... it was friggen pouring for hours - so the hour long wait OUTSIDE was understandable. It was the chaos and hour plus long wait for the food that we are going to simply rip apart...<br><br>So this time it was me, my lovely wife, and kids. (2 boys &amp; 2 girls - the youngest is only 8 months). If you are a parent reading this - you will feel my pain of a 2 hour wait to finally get us all fed! <br><br>The waitress - looked like she just stepped out of an MTV video from the 80&#39;s with all kinds of bracelets and chachkas all over her wearing this neon pink lipstick and had strange murderous eyebrows highlighted by the gothic black eye shadow...<br><br>Now for the fun part.. the sodas were all FLAT - the service continued to underwhelm us as it just took so long. I ordered soup and a well done English muffin (which never came). Also in her description of the soup she never said cold chopped tomatoes or soggy red peppers strewn about as a garnish. So the soup had cold dry chicken just thrown in as well as the artichoke hearts tasted mealy and certainly inedible... (SENT IT BACK) - still no English muffin - never mentioned again except for being charged for it (MY FAVORITE)...<br><br>My 5 year old&#39;s pizza arrived to the table late with a wonderful green slime around the part that was placed right in front of her, which she spots in an instant... The waitress says - &#34;oh that&#39;s only guacamole from another dish she had carried&#34; - but was not from our table (NICE). So that went back - and it took forever and a week to get her pizza out again - by that time we were all ready to leave. This time the pizza arrives partially underdone - and it has thin spots on it - you can&#39;t pick up half the pie... (AWESOME)...<br><br>To be fair the Chicken Romano was enjoyed by my 13 year old son - $16.50 but the red potatoes were cold and not really appetizing for anyone. <br><br>My wife&#39;s club sandwich was yummy - she said, but the french fries we always ask for  well done like black... and as usual - soggy crapola...<br><br>The sliders for my 11 year old son were fine - but then again he bearly can wait to finish to get back to his iTOUCH games - which he tried to sneak a game in underneath the table... No Game Playing while we are together in the Family Buzzom as I put it :)<br><br>3+ hours go by and we are all spent - I am ready to get the hell outta HELL and while the wife is changing a poopy diaper I decided to pay the tab... and then it happened... I turned around to see the 80&#39;s video extra and the check falls to the ground - while she is holding plates so I pick it up for her and she motions with her lips to place it in her apron pocket... I tried to but it would not fit, as there was another check book inside the pocket already - she then smiles weirdly and colorfully says &#34;yeah a got a BIG ONE&#34; - and laughs... <br><br>Being that a joke like that usually would come from a drunk guy at a bar - i thought it was odd, yet par for her course with the entire &#34;get-up&#34;... Needless to say my wife wanted to place her face on a milkcarton :) <br><br>So to top off the really long wait, really blah food and service - this was a HALF OF A STAR at best... Get your act together guys or you might end up with your CHEESE stuck out in the wind - at least at this location. There is Sawgrass and Aventura close buy - We probably won&#39;t be going back for a while...<br><br>UGH!!!!!!!!!!!!!

I normally love the Cheesecake Factory, but this particular one has severely lacking service. The first thing we noticed when we first sat down was that about a third of the silverware and plates on our table had food stuck to them. Our waitress would constantly speed past our table and pretend to not see us when we tried to get her attention. I had to wait over 20 minutes for a refill on my drink. We had to wave down other servers when we needed anything. We are currently waiting for the waitress to come back to get the check. It&#39;s been over 15 minutes. We are seriously considering walking out.
Service is great and everybody nice but is not like it used to be, I&#39;m no sure if they changed owner or what is it but the food was better before, cakes are still great

I came here for my birthday and the food was &#34;eh&#34;. I had the enchiladas. They tasted a little better than Chili&#39;s but I paid TWICE as much. The rice was crunchy and the black beans were not good at all. I will not be going back here anytime soon. $100 for a family dinner that was &#34;just okay&#34; feels like a waste of money to me. Such a disappointment. Spend your hard earned money elsewhere. The only reason they got the 3rd star was because our server was very polite and attentive.
Hey Cheesecake Factory!!!!! There are a lot of restaurants around you. First impressions matter. Make sure you hosts/hostesses welcome customers. Don&#39;t make us feel like we&#39;re bothering yo

Oh Cheesecake factory... Why do I love you so much? Is it your tasty Mai Tais? The incredibly fattening Chicken Bellagio.. or your delicious Tiramisu cheesecake? ... This place serves pretty much everything except Ribs.

Said I wasnt going to go back, but I do live in Cooper City and to find a decent place to eat is like NOT going to happen soooo.... I went back after my eh review with my family. <br>We tried the bar again and ordered a Mojoito from the bartender named Tiffany and LORD BLESS US AND SAVE US we have someone that can make a drink!!!!!!!!!<br>We love Tiffany and will only drink at the CF when she is at the bar. <br>We sat outside and the food was good but the service was SAAAAALOWWWWWW.<br><br>Will go back. Only because we dont have many choices out here.

Cousin&#39;s night out! On my first night in town, after much debate, we decided to come here when we remembered that they have the most variety in terms of alcohol that is served. I had the veggie burger whereas my cousins split up several appetizer. I didn&#39;t try too many of the appetizers but I did have a bit of the hummus and it was delicious. At the end, we split a slice red velvet cheesecake and it was amazing. Great service and good food.
Fucking awesome dude !!! My waiter was totally the fucking man I think his name was Robert .. great experience will most definitely come again man

I am a huge fan of The Cheesecake Factory and I have been to locations all over the country.  This location was smaller than other ones I have been to which did lead to a much louder than normal experience but the food was as always... very good.  <br><br>If you are looking for a restaurant in which everyone can find something to eat then this is your place (over 10 page menu!)-I recommend the buffalo blasts as an appetizer.  I recommend going for lunch for the lunch portion meals or if you go for dinner split a meal because I promise you that you will not be able to finish your meal.<br><br>And of course... you can never forget to finish the meal off with cheesecake- I am a fan of the classic cheesecake but I have had several others and they were all good just some too sweet for my taste.

I come for the cheesecake, but not often, because of the wait.  Expect an hour or more on the weekends.  The food is typically better than Red Robin or TGIF, so I can&#39;t say anything negative about the food.  Just come with some good apps on your phone or a book because you&#39;ll be waiting.
Always satisfied with the customer service and the food! My friends and I were more than happy enjoying our Thursday night here!

Been here like many of you many times.. Pretty consistent every time I visit. Wife and I order some drinks and came our pretty quick and we&#39;re very good. I ordered the chicken piccata which was great and my wife ordered pretzel crusted chicken and our waiter wanted to make sure she knew what she was ordering because he did he hadn&#39;t had good reviews on it.. I really appreciated his honesty and my wife orders chicken sandwich instead..  She loved it. For dessert we orders the tiramisu which was also good. They get 4 stars because it is really good and not GREAT. Honestly I&#39;m not sure how any big chains could do better...

Had my family with me and my in laws from out of town, how disappointed that the manager in charge decided to close off the outside area with an hour and half left to closing time. We just wanted to have cheesecake and coffee since my in laws were from out of town and had never been. How disappointing, it wasn&#39;t even a busy night. No efforts to be accommodating, at least it felt that way.  Very embarrassing for my husband and I.
Horrible service! The manager Heidi was so rude. The food might be good but the service is not worth it. 2hr wait to get an attitude from the staff.

If you think when you order you will get a small plate or portion you better ask for  a packaged box before hand. Diet Kill Warning. Delish, but a killer on your diet. Loved the food, will be back once I burn it off..

I only come here during special occasions... I love their sweet corn tamales, firecracker salmon, bang bang chicken &amp; shrimp, chicken madeira, red velvet cheesecake... Customer service has never been an issue. Due to the popularity of this place, you might end up waiting long; but no biggie for me, Pembroke Gardens is a nice place to do some people-watching.
Flys all over the place and mostly seen flying around and landed on glass wall between kitchen and dining area. Extremely warm dining space. Looonf wait and poor service. Ugh
the worst restaurant I have ever been. The food was awful. the server so slow. the floor was so greasy. I&#39;ll never come back again.
Great service! The entree I ordered didn&#39;t taste like what it was supposed to so I sent it back and they were happy to fix it. Supposedly they hired new cooks.

I love the Cheesecake Factory, but I&#39;ve never reviewed it for some reason.  So I was there again this week for an early dinner with a business associate.  We both got the chicken piccata.  I think this is a dish they do really well ( I think they do all their dishes well).<br><br>Very thin chicken cutlets are covered with a sauce containing lemons, capers, and mushrooms.  We deduced that the sauce must also contain heavy cream, a little wine possibly, and some butter, among other things.  It&#39;s accompanied by a small mound of vermicelli.  What a dish!  It is just sooo good.  I&#39;d be happy with this as a birthday meal, &#34;a last meal&#34;, or in lieu of a steak dinner.  Simple, tasty, and very filling.<br><br>I also like to order their passion flower iced tea.  Reminds me of Hawaii and almost makes me feel like I&#39;m eating my chicken piccata on a Maui beach.<br><br>Ahhhh.  I love the Cheesecake Factory.
Great dining experience!  Had a small issue but was overwhelmed by the response to make it right!!!  Heidi came and wowed us!

Wow I&#39;m glad they built a Cheesecake Factory in The Pembroke Gardens Mall because that&#39;s one of the restaurants Pembroke Pines didn&#39;t have.It used to be a humongous Gymboree store the size of a Cheesecake Factory.This location tends to get really busy during lunch hours but it&#39;s worth the 45 minute wait.This location is nicer and cleaner than the one in Coconut Grove.Our Waitress was nice I wish I could remember her name.My Strawberry Cheesecake was delicious and so was my Burger yummy I will come back to this particular location yelpers u should go

We are from N.Y. But visit  family in Pembroke Pines every 3 months. Went to the Cheesecake Factory and ate there.   The waiter was great, polite and attentive. the 3 dishes we ordered were all very good, and we shared a bit since the dishes are on the generous side. The pricing is good for the value although I find their appetizers somewhat overpriced...overall a very good choice, dependability with their food , very good service and good value for their main dishes. The only reason I didn&#39;t give 5 stars is because of the noise factor which at times can be loud. Our wait that night was only 15 minutes ( for 3 people). <br><br>Another night we ordered for take out to eat in our hotel room. The food was very good and they gave us everything we needed for the meal including the breads in the bread basket you get when seated at the table. We were not disappointed in any way. And enjoyed the meal even in our hotel room.

I visited here this past weekend with my family for a Birthday dinner and the service was horrible! The wait time for our group was over two hours long. After placing our orders, our food took another 45 minutes to come out. I ordered pasta and it was cold and the noodles were clumped together. One of our servers had a horrible attitude and became upset because we didn&#39;t like the service he was providing. Absolutely disgusting I wouldn&#39;t recommend anyone to visit this location.

I&#39;ve said it once and I&#39;ll say it again, you can&#39;t go wrong with Cheesecake Factory. I always sample new items since the menu is so overwhelmingly lengthy. The only constant is the Godiva Cheesecake...of course, until the new S&#39;mores Cheesecake comes out which I heard is soon. Can&#39;t wait!
Great experience and great dinner until I opened my leftovers at my house and found a rubber glove with my food, that was disgusting and unsanitary, never going back

My wife,daughter and Grandauter took me to dinner for my birthday on 3-9-2015. We were seated at the first booth on the left side of the entrance, right hsnd side, on the other side is the kitchen. The service was good, food was ok, but unfortunately my wife, who sat by the wall side of yhe booth, was surprised  by a ROACH, about an inch big! I did not wanted to ruin the evening  by creating a scandal, nor did anyone  in my family. It was my birthday. We gave the roach to the waitress. The assistant  manager came and offered us a free  dessert and we declined as wr had a birthday  cake  at home waiting.  An apology was offered by him but nothing else more, like this was a small problem, an everyday  occurrence.  To this day we fell dissapointed by the whole  experience  and vowed never to return,  left me wondering, us being  so close to the kitchen, if the roach came from the kitchen and if the food had contamination,  bad dreams  later, regreted eating the food.

Went here on a Sunday expecting it to be busy because it was a Sunday afternoon.  We were still suprised to see a line out of the door.  We already decided that we wanted to sit outside and noticed that no one else was sitting outside.  Now confident that we would probably not have to wait we went inside.  The hostess told us that the outdoor seating does not open up until later in the evening.  Their outdoor seating probably makes up 1/4 of all of their available seating.  We were shocked that with all of these people waiting that they wouldn&#39;t open more seating/call in additional servers.  We asked her how long the wait was and she said 50 min.  WOW<br><br>Seems like they don&#39;t want to make money.... I&#39;m not the type of person who will wait 50 minutes for ANY meal.  Weird way of doing business.... Won&#39;t go back.

1 star for the effort  I had been to several Cheesecake Factory restaurants in &amp; out of Florida but this is unbelievably baddd!!! The rice was UNCOOKED!!! How can you serve uncooked rice??!!! My girlfriend &amp; I ordered the same (Crispy Spicy Beef), the beef had heavy batter that you can taste the flour &amp; needless to say, soggy and not crispy! The presentation was horrible, they just scooped the rice &amp; it&#39;s all unevenly plated!!! Cheesecake Factory, shame on you!!! Not coming back to this location, that&#39;s for sure!!!<br>UPDATE: Decided to give the place another chance, had brunch here &amp; it was pretty good....
I love this place. But it is a bit over priced for the type of food they serve. But it is delicious
We love this location!!! The food is very consistent and the service is great!! I highly recommend this location!  We go every week as a family and we love it.

Worst cheesecake factory experience last week. Said to my family, we would never ever go back to this restaurant under any circumstances. Everything came out super spicy. Stuff that never was spicy had spice in it that day. All the food came out just terrible. The service was no where to be found and uninterested. It seems like this location hires some of the worst people for the job. <br><br>There was no manager to be found in the restaurant or i would have put up a fight.<br><br>On top of that, i had stomach pains for a whole day after. <br><br>AVOID THIS CHEESECAKE FACTORY AT ALL COSTS!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!

We enjoy Cheesecake Factory for lunch and dinner but there Breakfast menu and food in the morning is Horrible Our wait staff as well was all over the place forgot half our food and then the food was not even average. I do definatly reccomend there tamale appetizer as well as the sliders and they have plenty of good dishes. And you can&#39;t go wrong with there cheesecakes. The place will always be packed and service is hit or miss. We have found the bartendars are always  good .

You can&#39;t go wrong, overall, at this place.  Sure, you might get an ok dish here and there, but their menu is so huge that it suits all tastes.  Service is usually very good, as is the bar service.  It is what it is ... a lively, reasonably priced place with lots of options, most of which are great.  This particular location can get a little annoying with its wait time because it&#39;s one of the smaller locales, but all in all, they do a good job moving it along, and I personally have never felt rushed.

I love me some cheesecake factory, but this location is very small compared to every other cheesecake factory Ive visited before. Regardless of the size, the experience and the for is what matters. The menu is aways filled with variety. If you&#39;re a picky eater, no problem. They have tons of great dishes to choose from. <br><br>One of my favorite appetizers to share with a group is the deep fried macaroni and cheese. The servings are always large so it&#39;s good to keep in mind that you might want to plan to share with other&#39;s before ordering. <br><br>Another great thing to look forward to is the bread they bring to the table. They usually bring two different types of bread with butter to hold you over until the food arrives. It&#39;s so good, you may even want to ask if you can bring some of it home with you after the meal is over. <br><br>As far as the cheese cake goes, I&#39;ve always been way too stuffed to try any of their dessert. So I can&#39;t have any opinion on the specialty cheesecake they have. <br><br>Regardless of the size, this cheesecake factory tastes great.

I was with my family for our wedding anniversary celebration. It was a long line as  expected. The receptionist told me it was an hour wait so i can go around themLl and cone back 25 mins prior to 1 hour, so we did wince we have2 toddlers with us. We came back 25mins prior to our 1 hour wait. She told me my name was called and i will be placed back to waitlist. So we waited, and waited.i see new people getting seated except us. When i approached her, she told me10 more minutes, I was  pissed! I told her next time not to tell customers to walk around and come back after such time because i ended us waiting almost 2 hours. I was not even done talking and she turned next to the person waiting and ignored me! So rude and so unprofessional! The least i would expect from somebody who works for such a big company.  Never eating to cheesecake factory again! Such a disappointment! Ruined our day completely!

Never have I had such a bad experience like the one I had tonight. The night started with a friends birthday celebration party of 15. After waiting about and hour and a half, they sat a bigger party down before us when we had been there at least 30 min prior to them.  The bread that was put in our table was hard as a rock and not the least edible. Our drinks took about 20 min to order and then again another 20 min to order food. After a an hour and thirty min of waiting for food 5 dishes were returned as the pasta was hard. The manager was called and all the plates were returned to the kitchen, no more than 10 min later &#34;Newly cooked&#34; plates were brought out in hopes of fixing the error. All plates were returned  (Again) as the pasta was still hard and stale. By this point most of the party was done eating and 5 of us were out of dinner. When the manager came back to &#34;fix&#34; the problem, my husband ordered a Steak Diane to go. Desserts orders were taken and brought out and the steak was still no where to be found. Turns out it was forgotten about and had been sitting out for a while. Steak was over cooked and not to what was ordered. The manager did do his best and took care of our bill but still didn&#39;t make up for our experience (hence the two stars.)

Love Love Love!!!  Went on Sunday night to the Pembroke Gardens location. No wait.  Ordered the Chicken Enchiladas from the Skinnylicious menu and it was delicious. My daughter picked out the dessert (which is a must there) . This time we shared a Godiva Chocolate Cheescake and boy was it good!!!! Our waiter was excellent and will go back anytime.
I had two bites of my meal and it was so bad. This is my last time trying this location. I never had a good experience here.

Ordered my usual Seared tuna salad. It wasn&#39;t the same tuna I always get. Thinly sliced, not seared on the outside. And when pointing it out to our waitress, she told me it was just the way the new chef cut it. Didn&#39;t feel like sending my food back, or making a scene out of it. But when paying $19.00 for a salad at cheesecake, you would expect to get what you ordered. Waitress wasn&#39;t very nice either. Just a disappointing night..

I hadn&#39;t ate at the Cheesecake Factory since I got food poisoning from Grand Luxe a few years ago. The only reason I broke my personal boycott of all Cheesecake Factory owned restaurants is because someone gave my dad a $100 gift card and my family decided Father&#39;s Day is a good time to get rid of it. We anticipated having to wait at least an hour because that&#39;s just how it is at Cheesecake Factories everywhere. You wait obscenely long periods of time for mediocre food. This location is no exception. My family and I waited for 45 minutes. Their pager doesn&#39;t reach outside of the front door area so you&#39;re pretty much forced to stay close by. Once they paged us, we were herded like cattle into the front of the restaurant to another waiting space in the path of the waiters. Smart. This is something I&#39;ve never understood about Cheesecake Factory. They know that at EVERY location they&#39;ve ever established, that there&#39;s a long wait. Why not have a waiting room or a more advanced paging system so that people aren&#39;t jam packed into a small area? One of the hostess&#39; was far from friendly too. She clearly did not want to be at work this evening and her eye rolls every time she passed customers made it clear that she didn&#39;t care who knew it. Once we got to our table and placed our orders, the food was brought out in a timely manner. The calamari was not very good however. It was pretty much just batter. My mom ordered the skinny salmon dish and she said the salmon was dry. My dad thought his salmon from the regular menu was average. I ordered the skinny lemon shrimp and the shrimp was pretty flavorless. The dish was nothing to remember. All in all, our experience left a lot to be desired. Needless to say, we won&#39;t be waiting an hour at this place unless someone forces a Cheesecake Factory gift card upon us again (I pray to the heavens above that they don&#39;t).
I already love cheesecake but everytime I come to this location I&#39;m extra happy. I believe my servers name was Stephanie? She was amazing! Thanks for an amazing time :)

20 years ago, this would have been 5 stars. But there were far fewer locations then and much longer waits. These days, the food is okay at best. On more than one occasion, there&#39;s been an issue with freshness/quality of ingredients. And cleanliness! The flatware is always dirty and the floors are covered in trash. That said, my daughter loves it, so we go

I ate her before so the food is always the same (giant portions! people who have a salad for an appetizer just have it as a meal because its so big and has a ridiculous amount of calories).The only thing that bothered me was the waiter. She was not knowledgeable with her stuff. Messed up on some orders and when I asked for a white wine spritzer she goes &#34;we don&#39;t have that. I don&#39;t even know what it is.&#34; So I asked her to just tell the bartender and he even said he didn&#39;t know what it was. It is literally wine with club soda! So then when she comes back with it it tasted so bad! The mojito that my friend drank tasted horrible too. What a bad bartender.

Worst Cheesecakr Factory I&#39;ve been too.  Server was slow and messed up the order.  They finally brought my husband&#39;s entree 10 minutes after we had all finished eating.   On top of that, the manager came over to apologize offering a free cheesecake but refusing to comp the entree they messed up on.  I told her to keep her free cheesecake and she could keep the entree too.  Service was mediocre and the manager could use a refresher course on keeping repeat business.  She didn&#39;t get it right with us.  We definitely won&#39;t be going back to that location again.

Yuck!  Don&#39;t go here.  We gave them several chances, and it got worse each time.  Last time we were there, we received our food and it was uncooked.  It took 30 minutes to finally find our server.  We decided to just leave.  They even got our drinks wrong.  The manager did not charge us, but what a waste of time.  We ended up going across the street to the Tavern instead and it was very nice.

i had best lemon drop martini  in my life at the bar alone  few weeks ago. <br>after i got ton of makeup at sephora . <br>i dont know her name but she was pretty nice .<br>the reason i love cheese cake factory is great customer service and avocado spring roll.

It would be a negative star if it were allowed.  Horrible food, even worst service.  Skip this pace ..drive to any other location, but avoid this one. Went recently for a birthday dinner... The horrible waitress told us lie, after lie.  (the manage confirmed that it was a lie)... So disappointing.

A chain with fresh food. I have yet to go to The Cheesecake Factory and have what I would consider a bad meal. This particular Cheesecake Factory has opened near my home at The Shops at Pembroke Gardens. They introduced their new SkinnyLicious menu which includes alcoholic beverages under 150 calories, and salads and entrees which I believe do not exceed 800 calories which is commendable since they are known for serving SALADS THAT ARE 1500 calories!! I am no stranger to The Cheesecake Factory because it&#39;s a nice &#34;girls day out&#34; Happy Hour spot. They have a really nice happy hour menu but it ends super early (6 pm) so you gotta rush to get there after work and then hope there is parking available. I recommend you try the avocado egg rolls, the mushroom lettuce wraps, and the Thai salmon.  The skinny menu is nice and has many options also. I&#39;m sure no one is a stranger to the Cheesecake Factory as its a chain restaurant but if you&#39;re into Happy Hour with the girls or just hanging out for lunch with your significant other, they have outdoor seating and it&#39;s shaded. I think I might head over today for some crab cakes and a salad.
Great customer service, decor, and delicious food at a great value. Negative: Long wait time.
great happy hour five dollar long island ice teas but yOu have to sit by the bAr from four to six pm And then they have five dollar food. it wAs good service was excellent from Shana!

When I first discovered The Cheesecake Factory, it was a treat to go there. The ones that were around were far from where I lived so it was a special occasion to go there. Then, as it&#39;s gained popularity and the chains have increased in numbers.... it has become rather boring. In fact, the one in Aventural Mall is usually hit or miss. The food is good or it&#39;s pretty bad. It seems like the quality ranges depending on the chefs that night [?]. Who knows... but we decided to give this place a try---the second night it was open! Needless to say, everything is brand-spankin&#39; new and beautiful. The menu&#39;s are not caked with sticky fingerprints and oily covers... the place was spotless. The wait was short [weekday] and the hostess was friendly. Our waitress was VERY nice! The pumpernickel bread was delicious, as usual. That&#39;s my fix. Then the fried mac-n-cheese balls of course... hit the spot. By the time the main dish came around we were stuffed. The plates here, as with all Cheesecake&#39;s, are ginormous and are easily 2 1/2-3 REAL servings. The all-american staple right there... HUGE plates of food. Anyways, we had the Fettuccine Chicken and Sun-Dried Tomato pasta. It was delicious but such a huge plate. I also had the house Merlot which is called THE CHEESECAKE FACTORY and it&#39;s bottled by Robert Mondavi--- never knew this before! And we never got to the cheesecake as we were so stuffed from everything else. I&#39;m always bumbed when I don&#39;t eat cheesecake at the Cheesecake Factory.... I mean, it&#39;s just the principle of it all.

Food was great but the service was terrible. I am a Cheesecake fan but this store has issues. When I go out to eat its about the whole experience, not just the food. No matter how good the meal, if the service sucks, its not worth my time. Missed orders, lack of attention, and the non caring attitude of the server are enough to keep me from coming back to this establishment. On more than one occasion this has happened and not on days when it has been busy. Sad to report this but better restaurants very close by will be getting my business.

Today was my first and last time visiting this location. I go to the Cheesecake Factory at Aventura mall all the time, but visited this one today with my family to try their brunch for the first time. We had a large party, so of course we had to wait a while to be seated and to receive our food. The problem came once I actually got my food. I ordered the brunch combo, which is just pancakes, bacon, and eggs. There were two pancakes and the top pancake was hard and crusty as a rock. I informed one of the waiters and he was very polite and let me know he would bring more to the table. Next, I decided to try my eggs. They were cold and hard as well as if they sat on the stove well after being done then sat on the plate until the other items finished. I decided to just eat my other pancake. After cutting it into pieces, I noticed a bug on the underside. At first, I couldn&#39;t tell because it was so small. It looked like it may have just been a little rust from the grill, but after looking closely, I did see small wings and I knew that it was indeed a bug. I sent the plate back as my appetite was completely destroyed. The manager came over to ask if i wanted anything else, but I was done. I sat and sipped my drink while everyone else ate their food. When it came time to pay, the waiter went around collecting everyone&#39;s orders again so that he could ring up the tabs. I asked him if my drink would be on the house (not necessarily being serious, but just giving it a try) and he gave me a stern &#39;no.&#39; Although I did expect to pay for my drink, part of me felt that they would have at least given it to me on the house because I was literally the only one that sat there without food because of an error on their part. I&#39;ve never been one to write reviews, or speak to managers, or complain, I just simply choose not to return. However, I&#39;ve been noticing that a lot of restaurants are starting to put their profit before their customers. Things that used to be done to retain customer loyalty and repeat business are simply not done anymore and it&#39;s sad. Like I said, I wasn&#39;t looking for anything free and I didn&#39;t even make a deal out of it. I just won&#39;t be returning to this place again.

After boycotting this restaurant for a few months due to awful service and poorly/incorrectly prepared food, I decided to come back. Three visits now, I have found tiny bugs in my lettuce. Not only will I not return here, but I am now permanently disgusted by lettuce and salads in general bc of my experience here. They obviously do not care either, bc I have complained each time it has occurred! Thanks alot Cheesecake Factory.

This location is awful. Our waitress was never around. We waited 30 minutes for WATER, then when it did arrive, the cups were dirty. Our food came cold and overcooked. While we were waiting for our check, we watched a busser wipe down the table with a dirty towel and then with that same towel, he cleaned the silverware. GROSS. I will never come back here. I feel sick after eating here. A huge disappointment from a restaurant with a good reputation.
the wait is always long and the food portions are bigger than your head.<br><br>its a great place to waste time, gain weight, and conceive early on-set diabetes.  enjoy!

I love the CCF, but in this one for some reason the drinks are made for kids!!! Ok, I&#39;m not a drinker but I was on my girls night out reunion and I wanted a Cosmopolitan, so I order it and unfortunately for me,  the bartender forgot the main ingredient ALCOHOL!!!!  ;-(

The places is always packed so be prepared to wait. Once inside the place is nice, as is every other Cheesecake Factory. The menu has alot of choices and the food is pretty good. Yummy cheesecake of course!

The food is fantastic and desserts to die for. We live close to the one in Pembroke Pines and would like to order take out, except they either never answer the phone or answer and put you on hold for 10 minutes.  We end up ordering elsewhere. I do not recommend take out there unless you are lucky enough to get someone to answer the phone.

Would like to give 2-1/2 stars.....It&#39;s packed. Long waits and then long waits once seated. It&#39;s amazing how many people go to TCF as the food is ok at best. Cheesecake are the star but remember they are 1000-1500 cal each

Typical cheesecake factory although it is way more packed and not very huge.  The crowds and lines on the weekend are simply not worth the wait.  The food is consistent to other Cheesecake factories.  The service was great the day I went but it was also a Tuesday night.  The wait was 20 minutes and it wasn&#39;t packed at all.  I do like that another restaurant was added to Pembroke Gardens since it always seems the rest have astronomical weights.
There is always a wait but the food and service is worth it.  Try the pineapple upside down cake cheesecake.  Its AmAZiNg! I am looking forward to trying the brunch menu!!

The place is the most inefficient restaurant I&#39;ve ever visited.  They tell you the wait time is 30 minutes and an hour later you are still waiting.  My wife asked the hostess twice why the long wait and was told both times &#34;you are next&#34;.  Several people that arrived after us were seated before.  The last time my wife asked the hostess why the long wait, I said &#34;we are not eating here&#34; and all of the sudden the manager was trying to apologize - WELL TOO LATE.  If you want disrespectful treatment then definitely visit this place.  I think all Cheesecake Factory locations are a joke and should be boycotted.
The food is always great! No matter the location!!!  I have nothing bad to say about the Cheesecake Factory.  I always leave with a slice of Red Velvet cheesecake....

The Cheesecake Factory is the Cheesecake Factory with the exception of one location in which if you have read my other Yelps, you know what I am talking about.  I had a gift card so my wife and I decided to try this location since we had only ordered carryout from here in the past.  We requested a table outside and we didn&#39;t have to wait at all for one.  We were greeted promptly by Jerica.  Yes, her name was Jerica and she told us she was named for the character in Gem and the Holograms.  Can&#39;t say I&#39;ve heard that one before!  I usually order the Grande Burrito from The Cheesecake Factory; however, I wasn&#39;t super hungry that night so I decided on the chicken and biscuits instead.  I asked a few questions about this dish and seeing where I was going with this, the waitress let me know that she thought this probably wasn&#39;t a good dish for me to order since they put butter all over it.  She did check with the chef and he agreed and advised me to order something else since butter and I don&#39;t get along too well.  I took a few more minutes and ended up with the crispy buffalo chicken sandwich and fries.  The sandwich was good, not great and I probably will stick to non-sandwich items going forward although the burgers are pretty good.  Jerica was an excellent waitress including refilling our drinks, bringing the bread, delivering our food in a timely manner and taking care of the check very promptly.  She was definitely one of the better waitresses I have had recently.  Will I go back?  Sure.  But I&#39;ll make sure I am hungry and feast upon the Grande Burrito.

Went here yesterday for a late lunch with my family.  We were seated immediately but that&#39;s as far as the positives go.  We were seated on a pile of filth.  There was so much trash on the floor, seemed like no one has cleaned it ALL day.  Our waitress took our drink order and she just seemed like she had no want to be at her job.  We had no utensils or napkins.  I had to get up and take it from another table.  The bread was STALE! We didn&#39;t eat it and sent it back.  The bread plates on the table were also dirty, I had to clean it with my napkins.  My husband and my food came out 15 minutes BEFORE our kids.  The waitress was no where to be seen.  Normally kids food comes out first.  My husband and I both order from the lunch menu and ordered the Crusted Romano Chicken.  The pasta was dry, barely had any sauce. I can see now why this place was so empty yesterday.  Bad Service, Bad Cleanliness, Bad Food.
It&#39;s a great location, service and love the chicken Marsela.

While I&#39;m not usually a big fan of Cheesecake Factory, the weekend brunch is usually pretty decent. I went to this location today for brunch...It was terrible. There wasn&#39;t even much effort put into scrambling the eggs since they were practically raw,  the pancakes were sour (and these were not the lemon ricotta ones) and the service was horrendous. There&#39;s not too much of a selection of restaurants here in Pembroke Pines, but I can certainly do without paying for raw eggs and bad service.

I was thrilled to hear that a Cheesecake factory had opened in my area since I have been to the one in Aventura and have never been disappointed with their food. Being  a new restaurant, in the area the wait was rather long but expected. No complaints about the waiter but the food left much to be desired and very disappointing. i ordered a chicken dish and the second piece was completely burned on the bottom which I did not taste until I had eaten the first piece. By then I felt it was too late to return the food. The next time I will inspect my food closely prior to eating it. Don&#39;t think I will be going back anytime soon. The wait was not worth the food which was sub-standard...unlike the other Cheesecake factory rest. I have been to.
Excellent service! Delicious food. Wait isn&#39;t very long and the hostess is very friendly and polite. Lovely location and atmosphere! Chocolate mouse cheese cake is to die for! :-D

Today I visited the cheesecake factory (along with my sister )and I have visited before. It was a bit busy due to mothers day but it wasn&#39;t crazy. My service was great. My waitress marilyn S. was friendly..smiled often..and even though it was really busy she seemed to give us lots of attention. We order simple pastas..I had the chicken Alfredo and my sister had the three cheese pasta...when we received our pastas shortly after ordering...my pasta was bland (no salt or pepper)...chicken had no color and very tasteless ...the pasta was over cook and was mixed in with other pastas that wasn&#39;t in my dish...and my Alfredo was very runny/wet..my sister&#39;s pasta contained very little chicken was covered with tons of cilantro and parsley and was very bland...what is wrong with the chef did he/she not try any of the food before sending it out
